tables.name: authentication_report_attempts
tables.comment: Authorization attempts dataset for payments and setups that incorporates 3DS authentication data.

columns.name: attempt_id
columns.comment: Payment/setup attempt id.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Unix timestamp when the attempt was created.

columns.name: final_attempt_id
columns.comment: Final payment/setup attempt id.

columns.name: is_final_attempt
columns.comment: Was this the final payment/setup attempt?

columns.name: intent_id
columns.comment: Payment/setup intent id.

columns.name: intent_type
columns.comment: Type of the intent: `payment` | `setup`.

columns.name: charge_id
columns.comment: Charge id if the attempt resulted in a charge.

columns.name: charge_outcome
columns.comment: Outcome of the charge if any. Available values are `authorized`, `blocked`, `invalid`, `issuer_declined` and `manual_review`.

columns.name: charge_outcome_reason
columns.comment: Reason for the charge outcome if any.

columns.name: is_in_sca_scope
columns.comment: Is the payment or setup attempt in [SCA scope](https://stripe.com/docs/strong-customer-authentication).

columns.name: is_authenticated_by_digital_wallet
columns.comment: Is the transaction authenticated by the digital wallet?

columns.name: sca_exemption_requested
columns.comment: The type of [SCA exemption](https://support.stripe.com/questions/transaction-exemptions-for-strong-customer-authentication-sca) requested. Available values are `low_risk`, `low_value`, `merchant_initiated_transaction` and `moto`. Empty if transaction is not in SCA scope or no exemption was requested by Stripe.

columns.name: sca_exemption_status
columns.comment: Status of the [SCA exemption](https://support.stripe.com/questions/transaction-exemptions-for-strong-customer-authentication-sca) request if any. The available values are `exempt`, `non_sca_decline`, `authentication_required`.

columns.name: sca_exemption_mechanism
columns.comment: Mechanism used by Stripe to request an exemption, if any. Available values are `authorization` and `threeds`.

columns.name: is_threeds_triggered
columns.comment: Is [3DS authentication](https://stripe.com/docs/payments/3d-secure) triggered?

columns.name: threeds_outcome_result
columns.comment: Results from [3DS authentication](https://stripe.com/docs/payments/3d-secure) if any. Available values are `attempt_acknowledged`, `authenticated`, `delegated`, `exempted`, `failed`, `incomplete`, `not_attempted`, `not_supported` and `processing_error`.

columns.name: authentication_flow
columns.comment: The authentication flow, if [3DS authentication](https://stripe.com/docs/payments/3d-secure) was triggered. Available values are `challenge` and `frictionless`.

columns.name: protocol_version
columns.comment: Version of the 3DS protocol used, if [3DS authentication](https://stripe.com/docs/payments/3d-secure) was triggered. Available 3DS protocols are; `1.0.2`, `2.1.0` and `2.2.0`.

columns.name: threeds_reason
columns.comment: Reason for [3DS authentication](https://stripe.com/docs/payments/3d-secure) request, if any. The reasons can be `requested_by_radar_rule`, `requested_by_user_via_api`, `requested_by_stripe_exemption_engine`, `requested_by_issuer` or `unknown`.

columns.name: amount
columns.comment: Payment amount.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Currency of the payment.

columns.name: card_bin_country
columns.comment: BIN country of the card.

columns.name: merchant_country
columns.comment: Merchant's country.

columns.name: device_type
columns.comment: Type of device used to collect the card details. Available values are `desktop`, `mobile` and `unknown`.

columns.name: threeds_outcome_result_reason
columns.comment: When 3DS failed, this field provides the reason of failure.

tables.name: customer_change_events
tables.comment: The customer_change_events table tracks customer changes that affect Monthly Recurring Revenue (MRR). Use this table to calculate customer retention metrics and discover insights into customer history while creating custom metric definitions for retention, churn, and more.

columns.name: active_timestamp
columns.comment: The earliest time a customer is recognized as active. It is populated with the first active timestamp if it exists; otherwise, it uses the current timestamp if the current event is an ACTIVE_START. If the customer has never been active, the field is empty.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: customer_id
columns.comment: Customer related to this customer change event.

columns.name: event_timestamp
columns.comment: Time at which the customer change event occurred in UTC.

columns.name: event_type
columns.comment: The type of event that caused the customer change, either ACTIVE_START, ACTIVE_END, ACTIVE_UPGRADE, ACTIVE_DOWNGRADE, or REACTIVATE.

columns.name: mrr_change
columns.comment: The amount that MRR changed in the `currency` (in minor currency units) on the day of the `local_event_timestamp`

columns.name: local_event_timestamp
columns.comment: Time at which the customer change event occurred in the merchant's timezone. Calculated by taking the event_timestamp in milliseconds, converting it from UTC to local time using merchant.settings.timezone, which is then converted to an integer timestamp at second precision.

tables.name: subscription_item_change_events_v2_beta
tables.comment: Table containing the full history of each subscription item's MRR change. This table backed the subscription_item_change_events table in Sigma. Refreshed on a faster cadence.

columns.name: event_timestamp
columns.comment: Time at which the subscription item change event occurred in UTC.

columns.name: event_type
columns.comment: The type of event that caused the change.

columns.name: subscription_item_id
columns.comment: Subscription item related to this subscription item change event.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: mrr_change
columns.comment: The amount that MRR changed in the `currency` (in minor currency units) on the day of the `local_event_timestamp``.

columns.name: quantity_change
columns.comment: The amount that quantity changed on the day of the `local_event_timestamp``.

columns.name: subscription_id
columns.comment: Subscription related to this subscription item change event.

columns.name: customer_id
columns.comment: Customer related to this subscription item change event.

columns.name: price_id
columns.comment: Price related to this subscription item change event.

columns.name: product_id
columns.comment: Product related to this subscription item change event.

columns.name: local_event_timestamp
columns.comment: Time at which the subscription item change event occurred in the merchant’s timezone.

tables.name: billing_credit_grants
tables.comment: Prepaid or promotional billing credits allocated to a customer.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for this credit grant.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which this credit grant was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: updated
columns.comment: Time at which this credit grant was last updated. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: effective_at
columns.comment: The time when the billing credits become effective - when they’re eligible for use.

columns.name: expires_at
columns.comment: The time when the billing credits expire. If not present, the billing credits don’t expire.

columns.name: voided_at
columns.comment: The time when this credit grant was voided. If not present, the credit grant hasn’t been voided.

columns.name: applicability_config_scope_price_type
columns.comment: The price type that this credit grant can apply to.

columns.name: amount_type
columns.comment: The type of the amount for this credit grant.

columns.name: monetary_amount_currency
columns.comment: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase, of the monetary amount granted to the customer.

columns.name: monetary_amount_value
columns.comment: A positive integer representing the monetary amount granted to the customer.

columns.name: category
columns.comment: The category of this credit grant. This is for tracking purposes and isn’t displayed to the customer.

columns.name: customer_id
columns.comment: The ID of the customer receiving the billing credits.

columns.name: name
columns.comment: A descriptive name for this credit grant that is shown in the dashboard.

tables.name: billing_credit_grant_metadata
tables.comment: Key-value pairs that are attached to credit grants. Used for storing additional information about the credit grant.

columns.name: credit_grant_id
columns.comment: The credit grant ID to which this metadata is attached to.

columns.name: key
columns.comment: The metadata key.

columns.name: value
columns.comment: The metadata value.

tables.name: billing_credit_balance_transactions
tables.comment: Represents credit/debit transactions against an existing credit grant.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for this credit balance transaction.

columns.name: credit_grant_id
columns.comment: The credit grant ID associated with this credit balance transaction.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the credit balance transaction was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: type
columns.comment: The type of the transaction on the credit balance (credit or debit).

columns.name: credit_type
columns.comment: The type of the credit transaction applied on the credit balance.

columns.name: credit_amount_type
columns.comment: The type of the amount for the credit transaction.

columns.name: credit_monetary_amount_currency
columns.comment: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase, of the monetary amount.

columns.name: credit_monetary_amount_value
columns.comment: A positive integer representing the monetary amount.

columns.name: debit_type
columns.comment: The type of the debit transaction applied on the credit balance.

columns.name: debit_amount_type
columns.comment: The type of the amount for the debit transaction.

columns.name: debit_monetary_amount_currency
columns.comment: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase, of the monetary amount.

columns.name: debit_monetary_amount_value
columns.comment: A positive integer representing the monetary amount.

columns.name: invoice_id
columns.comment: For debits, the invoice ID where credits were applied. For credits, the voided invoice ID where reinstated credits were originally applied.

columns.name: invoice_line_item_id
columns.comment: For debits, the invoice line item ID where credits were applied. For credits, the voided invoice line item ID where reinstated credits were originally applied.

columns.name: effective_at
columns.comment: The effective time of this credit balance transaction.

tables.name: iins
tables.comment: Issuer identification numbers

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Issuer identification number of the card.

columns.name: bank
columns.comment: Issuer bank name of the card.

columns.name: description
columns.comment: Card description.

columns.name: country_code
columns.comment: Two-letter country code ([ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2)).

columns.name: incurred_at
columns.comment: Time of the event (described by `event_type`) that incurred this fee. Omitted for fees calculated based on activity over a period of time (e.g. Visa FANF), which are instead described by `attribution_start_time` and `attribution_end_time`.

columns.name: customer_id
columns.comment: The ID of the `customer` for whom the card was updated.

columns.name: card_id
columns.comment: The new card that resulted from the update.

columns.name: previous_card_id
columns.comment: The previous card that was updated.

columns.name: event_type
columns.comment: The event type for the CAU event, either CONTACT or UPDATE.

columns.name: fixed_per_item_amount
columns.comment: If applicable, the fixed component of this fee. Expressed in minor units of `fee_currency`.

columns.name: fixed_per_item_count
columns.comment: If applicable, the number of items to which the `fixed_per_item_amount` is applied. (Typically 1.)

columns.name: subtotal_amount
columns.comment: Total fee amount, excluding any tax and prior to any currency conversion. Expressed in minor currency units of `fee_currency`.

columns.name: tax_rate
columns.comment: If applicable, the rate of tax assessed on the fee's `subtotal_amount` . Values are between `0.0` and `1.0`.

columns.name: tax_amount
columns.comment: If applicable, the tax amount calculated as `subtotal_amount * tax_rate`. Expressed in minor currency units of `fee_currency`.

columns.name: total_amount
columns.comment: Sum of `subtotal_amount` and `tax_amount` before any currency conversion. Expressed in minor currency units of `fee_currency`.

columns.name: fx_rate
columns.comment: If applicable, currency exchange rate used to convert `total_amount` from `fee_currency` into `billing_currency`. Learn about [currency conversion rates](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies/conversions#calculating-foreign-exchange-rates)

columns.name: billing_currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO code for the currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies) in which your Stripe balance is debited for this fee.

columns.name: billing_amount
columns.comment: Total amount for this fee deducted from your Stripe balance, including taxes and after any currency conversion. Expressed in minor currency units of `billing_currency`; calculated as `total_amount * fx_rate`.

columns.name: balance_transaction_id
columns.comment: ID of the balance transaction that deducts this fee from your Stripe balance.  The balance transaction's amount will be the sum of the `billing_amount` for all fees with this `balance_transaction_id`.

columns.name: balance_transaction_created_at
columns.comment: Creation time of the balance transaction that deducts this fee from your Stripe balance. Expressed in seconds since the Unix epoch.

tables.name: charge_groups
tables.comment: Charge groups

columns.name: charge_id
columns.comment: Charge ID for this attempt.

columns.name: final_charge_id
columns.comment: Final charge ID of this attempt's charge group.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Timestamp of the charge.

columns.name: amount_in_usd
columns.comment: Presentment amount for this charge in USD.

tables.name: charges
tables.comment: To charge a credit or a debit card, you create a charge object.

columns.name: card_address_country
columns.comment: Billing address country, if provided when creating card.

columns.name: outcome_network_decline_code
columns.comment: For charges declined by the network, a brand specific 2, 3, or 4 digit code which indicates the reason the authorization failed.

columns.name: card_network
columns.comment: Identifies which network this charge was processed on. Can be `amex`, `cartes_bancaires`, `diners`, `discover`, `eftpos_au`, `interac`, `jcb`, `link`, `mastercard`, `unionpay`, `visa`, or `unknown`.

columns.name: customer_id
columns.comment: ID of the customer this charge is for if one exists.

columns.name: shipping_address_line2
columns.comment: Address line 2 (e.g., apartment, suite, unit, or building).

columns.name: captured
columns.comment: If the charge was created without capturing, this Boolean represents whether it is still uncaptured or has since been captured.

columns.name: card_exp_month
columns.comment: Two-digit number representing the card's expiration month.

columns.name: description
columns.comment: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

columns.name: outcome_rule_id
columns.comment: The ID of the Radar rule that matched the payment, if applicable.

columns.name: refunded
columns.comment: Whether the charge has been fully refunded. If the charge is only partially refunded, this attribute will still be false.

columns.name: failure_code
columns.comment: Error code explaining reason for charge failure if available (see [the errors section](/docs/error-codes) for a list of codes).

columns.name: shipping_address_state
columns.comment: State, county, province, or region.

columns.name: card_address_line1_check
columns.comment: If `address_line1` was provided, results of the check: `pass`, `fail`, `unavailable`, or `unchecked`.

columns.name: payment_method_id
columns.comment: ID of the payment method used in this charge.

columns.name: card_address_line2
columns.comment: Address line 2 (Apartment/Suite/Unit/Building).

columns.name: shipping_address_postal_code
columns.comment: ZIP or postal code.

columns.name: card_fingerprint
columns.comment:
Uniquely identifies this particular card number. You can use this attribute to check whether two customers who’ve signed up with you are using the same card number, for example. For payment methods that tokenize card information (Apple Pay, Google Pay), the tokenized number might be provided instead of the underlying card number.

*As of May 1, 2021, card fingerprint in India for Connect changed to allow two fingerprints for the same card---one for India and one for the rest of the world.*

columns.name: card_brand
columns.comment: Card brand. Can be `American Express`, `Diners Club`, `Discover`, `Eftpos Australia`, `Girocard`, `JCB`, `MasterCard`, `UnionPay`, `Visa`, or `Unknown`.

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: outcome_type
columns.comment: Possible values are `authorized`, `manual_review`, `issuer_declined`, `blocked`, and `invalid`. See [understanding declines](/docs/declines) and [Radar reviews](/docs/radar/reviews) for details.

columns.name: application_fee_id
columns.comment: The application fee (if any) for the charge. [See the Connect documentation](/docs/connect/direct-charges#collect-fees) for details.

columns.name: shipping_address_line1
columns.comment: Address line 1 (e.g., street, PO Box, or company name).

columns.name: card_address_state
columns.comment: State/County/Province/Region.

columns.name: card_address_city
columns.comment: City/District/Suburb/Town/Village.

columns.name: failure_message
columns.comment: Message to user further explaining reason for charge failure if available.

columns.name: balance_transaction_id
columns.comment: ID of the balance transaction that describes the impact of this charge on your account balance (not including refunds or disputes).

columns.name: receipt_email
columns.comment: This is the email address that the receipt for this charge was sent to.

columns.name: amount
columns.comment: Amount intended to be collected by this payment. A positive integer representing how much to charge in the [smallest currency unit](/docs/currencies#zero-decimal) (e.g., 100 cents to charge $1.00 or 100 to charge ¥100, a zero-decimal currency). The minimum amount is $0.50 US or [equivalent in charge currency](/docs/currencies#minimum-and-maximum-charge-amounts). The amount value supports up to eight digits (e.g., a value of 99999999 for a USD charge of $999,999.99).

columns.name: outcome_network_advice_code
columns.comment: For charges declined by the network, a 2 digit code which indicates the advice returned by the network on how to proceed with an error.

columns.name: card_address_zip_check
columns.comment: If `address_zip` was provided, results of the check: `pass`, `fail`, `unavailable`, or `unchecked`.

columns.name: card_token_type
columns.comment: If the card number is tokenized, this is the token type. For Apple Pay it can be `dpan`, `mpan`. For Google Pay Gateway integration it can be `pan`, `dpan`, `ecommerce_token`, `pan_with_3ds`. For Google Pay legacy integration it can be `fpan`, `dpan_or_ecommerce_token`.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: card_address_zip
columns.comment: ZIP or postal code.

columns.name: transfer_id
columns.comment: ID of the transfer to the `destination` account (only applicable if the charge was created using the `destination` parameter).

columns.name: receipt_number
columns.comment: This is the transaction number that appears on email receipts sent for this charge. This attribute will be `null` until a receipt has been sent.

columns.name: statement_descriptor
columns.comment:
For a non-card charge, text that appears on the customer's statement as the statement descriptor. This value overrides the account's default statement descriptor. For information about requirements, including the 22-character limit, see [the Statement Descriptor docs](https://docs.stripe.com/get-started/account/statement-descriptors).

For a card charge, this value is ignored unless you don't specify a `statement_descriptor_suffix`, in which case this value is used as the suffix.

columns.name: outcome_network_status
columns.comment: Possible values are `approved_by_network`, `declined_by_network`, `not_sent_to_network`, and `reversed_after_approval`. The value `reversed_after_approval` indicates the payment was [blocked by Stripe](/docs/declines#blocked-payments) after bank authorization, and may temporarily appear as "pending" on a cardholder's statement.

columns.name: card_tokenization_method
columns.comment: If the card number is tokenized, this is the method that was used. Can be `android_pay` (includes Google Pay), `apple_pay`, `masterpass`, `visa_checkout`, or null.

columns.name: amount_refunded
columns.comment: Amount in cents refunded (can be less than the amount attribute on the charge if a partial refund was issued).

columns.name: payment_method_type
columns.comment:
The type of transaction-specific details of the payment method used in the payment. See [PaymentMethod.type](/docs/api/payment_methods/object#payment_method_object-type) for the full list of possible types.
An additional hash is included on `payment_method_details` with a name matching this value.
It contains information specific to the payment method.

columns.name: card_name
columns.comment: Cardholder name.

columns.name: paid
columns.comment: `true` if the charge succeeded, or was successfully authorized for later capture.

columns.name: outcome_reason
columns.comment: An enumerated value providing a more detailed explanation of the outcome's `type`. Charges blocked by Radar's default block rule have the value `highest_risk_level`. Charges placed in review by Radar's default review rule have the value `elevated_risk_level`. Charges authorized, blocked, or placed in review by custom rules have the value `rule`. See [understanding declines](/docs/declines) for more details.

columns.name: status
columns.comment: The status of the payment is either `succeeded`, `pending`, or `failed`.

columns.name: on_behalf_of_id
columns.comment: The account (if any) the charge was made on behalf of without triggering an automatic transfer. See the [Connect documentation](/docs/connect/separate-charges-and-transfers) for details.

columns.name: card_id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: card_customer_id
columns.comment: The customer that this card belongs to. This attribute will not be in the card object if the card belongs to an account or recipient instead.

columns.name: shipping_address_city
columns.comment: City, district, suburb, town, or village.

columns.name: source_transfer_id
columns.comment: The transfer ID which created this charge. Only present if the charge came from another Stripe account. [See the Connect documentation](https://docs.stripe.com/connect/destination-charges) for details.

columns.name: card_last4
columns.comment: The last four digits of the card.

columns.name: outcome_seller_message
columns.comment: A human-readable description of the outcome type and reason, designed for you (the recipient of the payment), not your customer.

columns.name: card_cvc_check
columns.comment: If a CVC was provided, results of the check: `pass`, `fail`, `unavailable`, or `unchecked`. A result of unchecked indicates that CVC was provided but hasn't been checked yet. Checks are typically performed when attaching a card to a Customer object, or when creating a charge. For more details, see [Check if a card is valid without a charge](https://support.stripe.com/questions/check-if-a-card-is-valid-without-a-charge).

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: card_address_line1
columns.comment: Address line 1 (Street address/PO Box/Company name).

columns.name: transfer_group
columns.comment: A string that identifies this transaction as part of a group. See the [Connect documentation](/docs/connect/separate-charges-and-transfers#transfer-options) for details.

columns.name: card_default_for_currency
columns.comment: Only applicable on payout external account card belonging to merchant (not as payment source customer card in charge).

columns.name: calculated_statement_descriptor
columns.comment: The full statement descriptor that is passed to card networks, and that is displayed on your customers' credit card and bank statements. Allows you to see what the statement descriptor looks like after the static and dynamic portions are combined. This value only exists for card payments.

columns.name: card_country
columns.comment: Two-letter ISO code representing the country of the card. You could use this attribute to get a sense of the international breakdown of cards you've collected.

columns.name: payment_intent
columns.comment: ID of the PaymentIntent associated with this charge, if one exists.

columns.name: invoice_id
columns.comment: ID of the invoice this charge is for if one exists.

columns.name: card_dynamic_last4
columns.comment: (For tokenized numbers only.) The last four digits of the device account number.

columns.name: application_id
columns.comment: ID of the Connect application that created the charge.

columns.name: outcome_advice_code
columns.comment: An enumerated value providing a more detailed explanation on [how to proceed with an error](/docs/declines#retrying-issuer-declines).

columns.name: statement_descriptor_suffix
columns.comment: Provides information about a card charge. Concatenated to the account's [statement descriptor prefix](https://docs.stripe.com/get-started/account/statement-descriptors#static) to form the complete statement descriptor that appears on the customer's statement. If the account has no prefix value, the suffix is concatenated to the account's statement descriptor.

columns.name: card_funding
columns.comment: Card funding type. Can be `credit`, `debit`, `prepaid`, or `unknown`.

columns.name: card_exp_year
columns.comment: Four-digit number representing the card's expiration year.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: shipping_address_country
columns.comment: Two-letter country code ([ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2)).

tables.name: charges_metadata
tables.comment: Additional metadata fields associated with charges.

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: key
columns.comment: Name of the metadata key.

columns.name: value
columns.comment: Value of the metadata.

columns.name: charge_id
columns.comment: The ID of the charge that this metadata entry is associated with.

tables.name: checkout_line_items

columns.name: quantity

columns.name: description
columns.comment: An arbitrary string attached to the lien item. Defaults to product name.

columns.name: price_id
columns.comment: The ID of the price used to generate the line item.

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: product_id
columns.comment: The ID of the product associated with the price for the line item.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: checkout_session_id
columns.comment: The ID of the checkout session for the line item.

tables.name: invoice_line_items
tables.comment: Subscription invoice items become invoice line items when they are charged to a customer.

columns.name: quantity
columns.comment: The quantity of the subscription, if the line item is a subscription or a proration.

columns.name: proration_details_credited_items_invoice
columns.comment: Invoice containing the credited invoice line items

columns.name: proration_details_credited_items_invoice_line_items
columns.comment: Credited invoice line items

columns.name: description
columns.comment: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

columns.name: price_id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: discountable
columns.comment: If true, discounts will apply to this line item. Always false for prorations.

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: source_type
columns.comment: A string identifying the type of the source of this line item, either an `invoiceitem` or a `subscription`.

columns.name: amount
columns.comment: The amount, in cents.

columns.name: period_start
columns.comment: The start of the period. This value is inclusive.

columns.name: proration
columns.comment: Whether this is a proration.

columns.name: plan_id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: period_end
columns.comment: The end of the period, which must be greater than or equal to the start. This value is inclusive.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: The globally unique id for this invoice line item.

columns.name: invoice_item_id
columns.comment: The ID of the [invoice item](/docs/api/invoiceitems) associated with this line item if any.

columns.name: source_id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: subscription_item_id
columns.comment: The subscription item that generated this line item. Left empty if the line item is not an explicit result of a subscription.

tables.name: invoices_metadata
tables.comment: Additional metadata fields associated with invoices.

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: key
columns.comment: Name of the metadata key.

columns.name: value

columns.name: invoice_id
columns.comment: The ID of the invoice that this metadata entry is associated with.

tables.name: transfers_metadata

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: key
columns.comment: Name of the metadata key.

columns.name: transfer_id
columns.comment: The ID of the transfer that this metadata entry is associated with.

columns.name: value
columns.comment: Value of the metadata.

tables.name: transfers
tables.comment: A transfer object is created when you receive funds from Stripe or you initiate a transfer to either a bank account or debit card of a connected Stripe account.

columns.name: automatic
columns.comment: Returns `true` if the payout was created by an [automated payout schedule](/docs/payouts#payout-schedule), and `false` if it was [requested manually](https://stripe.com/docs/payouts#manual-payouts).

columns.name: source_transaction_id
columns.comment: ID of the charge (or other transaction) that was used to fund the transfer. If null, the transfer was funded from the available balance.

columns.name: failure_code
columns.comment: Error code explaining reason for transfer failure if available. See [Types of transfer failures](/docs/api#transfer_failures) for a list of failure codes.

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: application_fee_id
columns.comment: The application fee (if any). [See the Connect documentation](/docs/connect/direct-charges#collect-fees) for details.

columns.name: amount_reversed
columns.comment: Amount in cents reversed (can be less than the amount attribute on the transfer if a partial reversal was issued).

columns.name: source_type
columns.comment: The source balance this transfer came from. One of `card`, `fpx`, or `bank_account`.

columns.name: failure_message
columns.comment: Message to user further explaining reason for transfer failure if available.

columns.name: balance_transaction_id
columns.comment: Balance transaction that describes the impact of this transfer on your account balance.

columns.name: amount
columns.comment: Amount (in cents) to be transferred to your bank account.

columns.name: application_fee_amount
columns.comment: The amount of the application fee (if any) requested for the payout.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: statement_descriptor
columns.comment: Extra information about a transfer to be displayed on the user's bank statement.

columns.name: date
columns.comment: Date the transfer is scheduled to arrive in the bank. This factors in delays like weekends or bank holidays.

columns.name: destination_id
columns.comment: ID of the bank account, card, or Stripe account the transfer was sent to.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: transfer_group
columns.comment: A string that identifies this transaction as part of a group. See the [Connect documentation](/docs/connect/separate-charges-and-transfers#transfer-options) for details.

columns.name: type
columns.comment: Can be `card`, `bank_account`, or `stripe_account`.

columns.name: reversed
columns.comment: Whether the transfer has been fully reversed. If the transfer is only partially reversed, this attribute will still be false.

columns.name: destination_payment_id
columns.comment: If the destination is a Stripe account, this will be the ID of the payment that the destination account received for the transfer.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

tables.name: invoices
tables.comment: Invoices are statements of what a customer owes for a particular billing period, including subscriptions, invoice items, and any automatic proration adjustments if necessary.

columns.name: amount_due
columns.comment: Final amount due at this time for this invoice. If the invoice's total is smaller than the minimum charge amount, for example, or if there is account credit that can be applied to the invoice, the `amount_due` may be 0. If there is a positive `starting_balance` for the invoice (the customer owes money), the `amount_due` will also take that into account. The charge that gets generated for the invoice will be for the amount specified in `amount_due`.

columns.name: number
columns.comment: A unique, identifying string that appears on emails sent to the customer for this invoice. This starts with the customer's unique invoice_prefix if it is specified.

columns.name: discount_coupon_id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: shipping_details_address_line2
columns.comment: Address line 2 (e.g., apartment, suite, unit, or building).

columns.name: shipping_details_address_city
columns.comment: City, district, suburb, town, or village.

columns.name: discount_subscription
columns.comment: The subscription that this coupon is applied to, if it is applied to a particular subscription.

columns.name: customer_address_postal_code
columns.comment: ZIP or postal code.

columns.name: transfer_data_amount
columns.comment: The amount in cents that will be transferred to the destination account when the invoice is paid. By default, the entire amount is transferred to the destination.

columns.name: customer_email
columns.comment: The customer's email. Until the invoice is finalized, this field will equal `customer.email`. Once the invoice is finalized, this field will no longer be updated.

columns.name: pre_payment_credit_notes_amount
columns.comment: Total amount of all pre-payment credit notes issued for this invoice.

columns.name: discount_start
columns.comment: Date that the coupon was applied.

columns.name: discount_invoice
columns.comment: The invoice that the discount's coupon was applied to, if it was applied directly to a particular invoice.

columns.name: tax_percent
columns.comment: This percentage of the subtotal has been added to the total amount of the invoice, including invoice line items and discounts. This field is inherited from the subscription's `tax_percent` field, but can be changed before the invoice is paid. This field defaults to null.

columns.name: customer_phone
columns.comment: The customer's phone number. Until the invoice is finalized, this field will equal `customer.phone`. Once the invoice is finalized, this field will no longer be updated.

columns.name: customer_address_city
columns.comment: City, district, suburb, town, or village.

columns.name: customer_id
columns.comment: The ID of the customer who will be billed.

columns.name: customer_name
columns.comment: The customer's name. Until the invoice is finalized, this field will equal `customer.name`. Once the invoice is finalized, this field will no longer be updated.

columns.name: starting_balance
columns.comment: Starting customer balance before the invoice is finalized. If the invoice has not been finalized yet, this will be the current customer balance.

columns.name: status_transitions_voided_at
columns.comment: The time that the invoice was voided.

columns.name: tax
columns.comment: The amount of tax on this invoice. This is the sum of all the tax amounts on this invoice.

columns.name: description
columns.comment: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users. Referenced as 'memo' in the Dashboard.

columns.name: amount_shipping
columns.comment: This is the sum of all the shipping amounts.

columns.name: quote_id
columns.comment: The quote this invoice was generated from.

columns.name: customer_shipping_address_line2
columns.comment: Address line 2 (e.g., apartment, suite, unit, or building).

columns.name: customer_shipping_address_state
columns.comment: State, county, province, or region.

columns.name: shipping_details_address_state
columns.comment: State, county, province, or region.

columns.name: automatic_tax_enabled
columns.comment: Whether Stripe automatically computes tax on this invoice. Note that incompatible invoice items (invoice items with manually specified [tax rates](/docs/api/tax_rates), negative amounts, or `tax_behavior=unspecified`) cannot be added to automatic tax invoices.

columns.name: status_transitions_marked_uncollectible_at
columns.comment: The time that the invoice was marked uncollectible.

columns.name: shipping_cost_amount_subtotal
columns.comment: Total shipping cost before any taxes are applied.

columns.name: subscription_proration_date
columns.comment: Only set for upcoming invoices that preview prorations. The time used to calculate prorations.

columns.name: default_payment_method_id
columns.comment: ID of the default payment method for the invoice. It must belong to the customer associated with the invoice. If not set, defaults to the subscription's default payment method, if any, or to the default payment method in the customer's invoice settings.

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: customer_tax_exempt
columns.comment: The customer's tax exempt status. Until the invoice is finalized, this field will equal `customer.tax_exempt`. Once the invoice is finalized, this field will no longer be updated.

columns.name: next_payment_attempt
columns.comment: The time at which payment will next be attempted. This value will be `null` for invoices where `collection_method=send_invoice`.

columns.name: customer_shipping_address_city
columns.comment: City, district, suburb, town, or village.

columns.name: transfer_data_destination_id
columns.comment: The account where funds from the payment will be transferred to upon payment success.

columns.name: total
columns.comment: Total after discounts and taxes.

columns.name: shipping_cost_amount_tax
columns.comment: Total tax amount applied due to shipping costs. If no tax was applied, defaults to 0.

columns.name: amount_remaining
columns.comment: The difference between amount_due and amount_paid, in cents.

columns.name: period_start
columns.comment: Start of the usage period during which invoice items were added to this invoice. This looks back one period for a subscription invoice. Use the [line item period](/api/invoices/line_item#invoice_line_item_object-period) to get the service period for each price.

columns.name: discount_invoice_item
columns.comment: The invoice item `id` (or invoice line item `id` for invoice line items of type='subscription') that the discount's coupon was applied to, if it was applied directly to a particular invoice item or invoice line item.

columns.name: discount_subscription_item
columns.comment: The subscription item that this coupon is applied to, if it is applied to a particular subscription item.

columns.name: customer_shipping_address_postal_code
columns.comment: ZIP or postal code.

columns.name: customer_shipping_address_country
columns.comment: Two-letter country code ([ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2)).

columns.name: period_end
columns.comment: End of the usage period during which invoice items were added to this invoice. This looks back one period for a subscription invoice. Use the [line item period](/api/invoices/line_item#invoice_line_item_object-period) to get the service period for each price.

columns.name: attempt_count
columns.comment: Number of payment attempts made for this invoice, from the perspective of the payment retry schedule. Any payment attempt counts as the first attempt, and subsequently only automatic retries increment the attempt count. In other words, manual payment attempts after the first attempt do not affect the retry schedule. If a failure is returned with a non-retryable return code, the invoice can no longer be retried unless a new payment method is obtained. Retries will continue to be scheduled, and attempt_count will continue to increment, but retries will only be executed if a new payment method is obtained.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object. For preview invoices created using the [create preview](https://stripe.com/docs/api/invoices/create_preview) endpoint, this id will be prefixed with `upcoming_in`.

columns.name: customer_address_state
columns.comment: State, county, province, or region.

columns.name: webhooks_delivered_at
columns.comment: Invoices are automatically paid or sent 1 hour after webhooks are delivered, or until all webhook delivery attempts have [been exhausted](/docs/billing/webhooks#understand). This field tracks the time when webhooks for this invoice were successfully delivered. If the invoice had no webhooks to deliver, this will be set while the invoice is being created.

columns.name: receipt_number
columns.comment: This is the transaction number that appears on email receipts sent for this invoice.

columns.name: statement_descriptor
columns.comment: Extra information about an invoice for the customer's credit card statement.

columns.name: customer_shipping_address_line1
columns.comment: Address line 1 (e.g., street, PO Box, or company name).

columns.name: date
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: discounts
columns.comment: The discounts applied to the invoice. Line item discounts are applied before invoice discounts. Use `expand[]=discounts` to expand each discount.

columns.name: customer_address_line2
columns.comment: Address line 2 (e.g., apartment, suite, unit, or building).

columns.name: customer_shipping_phone
columns.comment: Customer phone (including extension).

columns.name: paid
columns.comment: Whether payment was successfully collected for this invoice. An invoice can be paid (most commonly) with a charge or with credit from the customer's account balance.

columns.name: customer_shipping_name
columns.comment: Customer name.

columns.name: status
columns.comment: The status of the invoice, one of `draft`, `open`, `paid`, `uncollectible`, or `void`. [Learn more](/docs/billing/invoices/workflow#workflow-overview)

columns.name: on_behalf_of_id
columns.comment: The account (if any) for which the funds of the invoice payment are intended. If set, the invoice will be presented with the branding and support information of the specified account. See the [Invoices with Connect](/docs/billing/invoices/connect) documentation for details.

columns.name: shipping_details_name
columns.comment: Recipient name.

columns.name: shipping_cost_amount_total
columns.comment: Total shipping cost after taxes are applied.

columns.name: status_transitions_paid_at
columns.comment: The time that the invoice was paid.

columns.name: due_date
columns.comment: The date on which payment for this invoice is due. This value will be `null` for invoices where `collection_method=charge_automatically`.

columns.name: amount_paid
columns.comment: The amount, in cents, that was paid.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: subtotal
columns.comment: Total of all subscriptions, invoice items, and prorations on the invoice before any invoice level discount or exclusive tax is applied. Item discounts are already incorporated

columns.name: shipping_details_phone
columns.comment: Recipient phone (including extension).

columns.name: attempted
columns.comment: Whether an attempt has been made to pay the invoice. An invoice is not attempted until 1 hour after the `invoice.created` webhook, for example, so you might not want to display that invoice as unpaid to your users.

columns.name: subscription_id
columns.comment: The subscription that this invoice was prepared for, if any.

columns.name: discount_end
columns.comment: If the coupon has a duration of `repeating`, the date that this discount will end. If the coupon has a duration of `once` or `forever`, this attribute will be null.

columns.name: shipping_details_address_country
columns.comment: Two-letter country code ([ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2)).

columns.name: auto_advance
columns.comment: Controls whether Stripe performs [automatic collection](/docs/invoicing/integration/automatic-advancement-collection) of the invoice. If `false`, the invoice's state doesn't automatically advance without an explicit action.

columns.name: customer_address_country
columns.comment: Two-letter country code ([ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2)).

columns.name: shipping_details_address_line1
columns.comment: Address line 1 (e.g., street, PO Box, or company name).

columns.name: customer_address_line1
columns.comment: Address line 1 (e.g., street, PO Box, or company name).

columns.name: automatic_tax_status
columns.comment: The status of the most recent automated tax calculation for this invoice.

columns.name: paid_out_of_band
columns.comment: Returns true if the invoice was manually marked paid, returns false if the invoice hasn't been paid yet or was paid on Stripe.

columns.name: discount_promotion_code_id
columns.comment: The promotion code applied to create this discount.

columns.name: post_payment_credit_notes_amount
columns.comment: Total amount of all post-payment credit notes issued for this invoice.

columns.name: effective_at
columns.comment: The date when this invoice is in effect. Same as `finalized_at` unless overwritten. When defined, this value replaces the system-generated 'Date of issue' printed on the invoice PDF and receipt.

columns.name: discount_customer_id
columns.comment: The ID of the customer associated with this discount.

columns.name: shipping_details_address_postal_code
columns.comment: ZIP or postal code.

columns.name: billing_reason
columns.comment:
Indicates the reason why the invoice was created.

* `manual`: Unrelated to a subscription, for example, created via the invoice editor.
* `subscription`: No longer in use. Applies to subscriptions from before May 2018 where no distinction was made between updates, cycles, and thresholds.
* `subscription_create`: A new subscription was created.
* `subscription_cycle`: A subscription advanced into a new period.
* `subscription_threshold`: A subscription reached a billing threshold.
* `subscription_update`: A subscription was updated.
* `upcoming`: Reserved for simulated invoices, per the upcoming invoice endpoint.

columns.name: footer
columns.comment: Footer displayed on the invoice.

columns.name: application_id
columns.comment: ID of the Connect Application that created the invoice.

columns.name: shipping_cost_shipping_rate_id
columns.comment: The ID of the ShippingRate for this invoice.

columns.name: status_transitions_finalized_at
columns.comment: The time that the invoice draft was finalized.

columns.name: discount_checkout_session
columns.comment: The Checkout session that this coupon is applied to, if it is applied to a particular session in payment mode. Will not be present for subscription mode.

columns.name: charge_id
columns.comment: ID of the latest charge generated for this invoice, if any.

tables.name: payment_methods
tables.comment: PaymentMethod objects represent your customer's payment instruments.

columns.name: p24_bank
columns.comment: The customer's bank. Can be one of `ing`, `citi_handlowy`, `tmobile_usbugi_bankowe`, `plus_bank`, `etransfer_pocztowy24`, `banki_spbdzielcze`, `bank_nowy_bfg_sa`, `getin_bank`, `velobank`, `blik`, `noble_pay`, `ideabank`, `envelobank`, `santander_przelew24`, `nest_przelew`, `mbank_mtransfer`, `inteligo`, `pbac_z_ipko`, `bnp_paribas`, `credit_agricole`, `toyota_bank`, `bank_pekao_sa`, `volkswagen_bank`, `bank_millennium`, `alior_bank`, or `boz`.

columns.name: sofort_country
columns.comment: Two-letter ISO code representing the country the bank account is located in.

columns.name: acss_debit_institution_number
columns.comment: Institution number of the bank account.

columns.name: sepa_debit_generated_from_setup_attempt_id
columns.comment: The ID of the SetupAttempt that generated this PaymentMethod, if any.

columns.name: acss_debit_last4
columns.comment: Last four digits of the bank account number.

columns.name: upi_vpa
columns.comment: Virtual Payment Address

columns.name: sepa_debit_generated_from_charge_id
columns.comment: The ID of the Charge that generated this PaymentMethod, if any.

columns.name: paypal_payer_id
columns.comment: PayPal account PayerID. This identifier uniquely identifies the PayPal customer.

columns.name: ideal_bank
columns.comment: The customer's bank, if provided. Can be one of `abn_amro`, `asn_bank`, `bunq`, `buut`, `finom`, `handelsbanken`, `ing`, `knab`, `mollie`, `moneyou`, `n26`, `nn`, `rabobank`, `regiobank`, `revolut`, `sns_bank`, `triodos_bank`, `van_lanschot`, or `yoursafe`.

columns.name: nz_bank_account_bank_name
columns.comment: The name of the bank.

columns.name: card_exp_month
columns.comment: Two-digit number representing the card's expiration month.

columns.name: payto_pay_id
columns.comment: The PayID alias for the bank account.

columns.name: us_bank_account_linked_account
columns.comment: The ID of the Financial Connections Account used to create the payment method.

columns.name: custom_type
columns.comment: The custom payment method type associated with this custom payment method.

columns.name: fpx_account_holder_type
columns.comment: Account holder type, if provided. Can be one of `individual` or `company`.

columns.name: card_address_line1_check
columns.comment: If a address line1 was provided, results of the check, one of `pass`, `fail`, `unavailable`, or `unchecked`.

columns.name: bacs_debit_last4
columns.comment: Last four digits of the bank account number.

columns.name: paypal_payer_email
columns.comment:
Owner's email. Values are provided by PayPal directly
(if supported) at the time of authorization or settlement. They cannot be set or mutated.

columns.name: card_wallet_apple_pay_type
columns.comment: Apple Pay type. Can be `apple_pay`, `apple_pay_later` or `unknown`.

columns.name: card_fingerprint
columns.comment:
Uniquely identifies this particular card number. You can use this attribute to check whether two customers who’ve signed up with you are using the same card number, for example. For payment methods that tokenize card information (Apple Pay, Google Pay), the tokenized number might be provided instead of the underlying card number.

*As of May 1, 2021, card fingerprint in India for Connect changed to allow two fingerprints for the same card---one for India and one for the rest of the world.*

columns.name: card_brand
columns.comment: Card brand. Can be `amex`, `cartes_bancaires`, `diners`, `discover`, `eftpos_au`, `jcb`, `link`, `mastercard`, `unionpay`, `visa` or `unknown`.

columns.name: au_becs_debit_fingerprint
columns.comment: Uniquely identifies this particular bank account. You can use this attribute to check whether two bank accounts are the same.

columns.name: card_brand_product
columns.comment: The [product code](https://stripe.com/docs/card-product-codes) that identifies the specific program or product associated with a card.

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: payto_bsb_number
columns.comment: Bank-State-Branch number of the bank account.

columns.name: acss_debit_transit_number
columns.comment: Transit number of the bank account.

columns.name: us_bank_account_fingerprint
columns.comment: Uniquely identifies this particular bank account. You can use this attribute to check whether two bank accounts are the same.

columns.name: payto_account_number
columns.comment: The account number for the bank account.

columns.name: ideal_bic
columns.comment: The Bank Identifier Code of the customer's bank, if the bank was provided.

columns.name: fpx_bank
columns.comment: The customer's bank, if provided. Can be one of `affin_bank`, `agrobank`, `alliance_bank`, `ambank`, `bank_islam`, `bank_muamalat`, `bank_rakyat`, `bsn`, `cimb`, `hong_leong_bank`, `hsbc`, `kfh`, `maybank2u`, `ocbc`, `public_bank`, `rhb`, `standard_chartered`, `uob`, `deutsche_bank`, `maybank2e`, `pb_enterprise`, or `bank_of_china`.

columns.name: card_regulated_status
columns.comment: Status of a card based on the card issuer.

columns.name: acss_debit_fingerprint
columns.comment: Uniquely identifies this particular bank account. You can use this attribute to check whether two bank accounts are the same.

columns.name: card_iin
columns.comment: Issuer identification number of the card.

columns.name: us_bank_account_account_holder_type
columns.comment: Account holder type: individual or company.

columns.name: bacs_debit_fingerprint
columns.comment: Uniquely identifies this particular bank account. You can use this attribute to check whether two bank accounts are the same.

columns.name: au_becs_debit_bsb_number
columns.comment: Six-digit number identifying bank and branch associated with this bank account.

columns.name: sepa_debit_last4
columns.comment: Last four characters of the IBAN.

columns.name: sepa_debit_bank_code
columns.comment: Bank code of bank associated with the bank account.

columns.name: us_bank_account_account_type
columns.comment: Account type: checkings or savings. Defaults to checking if omitted.

columns.name: us_bank_account_last4
columns.comment: Last four digits of the bank account number.

columns.name: link_email
columns.comment: Account owner's email address.

columns.name: card_three_d_secure_supported
columns.comment: Whether 3D Secure is supported on this card.

columns.name: card_generated_from_charge_id
columns.comment: The charge that created this object.

columns.name: nz_bank_account_last4
columns.comment: Last four digits of the bank account number.

columns.name: au_becs_debit_last4
columns.comment: Last four digits of the bank account number.

columns.name: nz_bank_account_suffix
columns.comment: The suffix of the bank account number.

columns.name: card_last4
columns.comment: The last four digits of the card.

columns.name: boleto_tax_id
columns.comment: Uniquely identifies the customer tax id (CNPJ or CPF)

columns.name: cashapp_cashtag
columns.comment: A public identifier for buyers using Cash App.

columns.name: payto_last4
columns.comment: Last four digits of the bank account number.

columns.name: bacs_debit_sort_code
columns.comment: Sort code of the bank account. (e.g., `10-20-30`)

columns.name: nz_bank_account_account_holder_name
columns.comment: The name on the bank account. Only required if the account holder name is different from the name of the authorized signatory collected in the PaymentMethod’s billing details.

columns.name: us_bank_account_routing_number
columns.comment: Routing number of the bank account.

columns.name: card_cvc_check
columns.comment: If a CVC was provided, results of the check, one of `pass`, `fail`, `unavailable`, or `unchecked`.

columns.name: sepa_debit_country
columns.comment: Two-letter ISO code representing the country the bank account is located in.

columns.name: cashapp_buyer_id
columns.comment: A unique and immutable identifier assigned by Cash App to every buyer.

columns.name: sepa_debit_branch_code
columns.comment: Branch code of bank associated with the bank account.

columns.name: card_wallet_type
columns.comment: The type of the card wallet

columns.name: card_address_postal_code_check
columns.comment: If a address postal code was provided, results of the check, one of `pass`, `fail`, `unavailable`, or `unchecked`.

columns.name: nz_bank_account_bank_code
columns.comment: The numeric code for the bank account's bank.

columns.name: sepa_debit_fingerprint
columns.comment: Uniquely identifies this particular bank account. You can use this attribute to check whether two bank accounts are the same.

columns.name: nz_bank_account_branch_code
columns.comment: The numeric code for the bank account's bank branch.

columns.name: eps_bank
columns.comment: The customer's bank. Should be one of `arzte_und_apotheker_bank`, `austrian_anadi_bank_ag`, `bank_austria`, `bankhaus_carl_spangler`, `bankhaus_schelhammer_und_schattera_ag`, `bawag_psk_ag`, `bks_bank_ag`, `brull_kallmus_bank_ag`, `btv_vier_lander_bank`, `capital_bank_grawe_gruppe_ag`, `deutsche_bank_ag`, `dolomitenbank`, `easybank_ag`, `erste_bank_und_sparkassen`, `hypo_alpeadriabank_international_ag`, `hypo_noe_lb_fur_niederosterreich_u_wien`, `hypo_oberosterreich_salzburg_steiermark`, `hypo_tirol_bank_ag`, `hypo_vorarlberg_bank_ag`, `hypo_bank_burgenland_aktiengesellschaft`, `marchfelder_bank`, `oberbank_ag`, `raiffeisen_bankengruppe_osterreich`, `schoellerbank_ag`, `sparda_bank_wien`, `volksbank_gruppe`, `volkskreditbank_ag`, or `vr_bank_braunau`.

columns.name: card_country
columns.comment: Two-letter ISO code representing the country of the card. You could use this attribute to get a sense of the international breakdown of cards you've collected.

columns.name: card_funding
columns.comment: Card funding type. Can be `credit`, `debit`, `prepaid`, or `unknown`.

columns.name: card_exp_year
columns.comment: Four-digit number representing the card's expiration year.

tables.name: payment_method_details
tables.comment: Information of payment method used at the time of charge.

columns.name: p24_bank
columns.comment: The customer's bank. Can be one of `ing`, `citi_handlowy`, `tmobile_usbugi_bankowe`, `plus_bank`, `etransfer_pocztowy24`, `banki_spbdzielcze`, `bank_nowy_bfg_sa`, `getin_bank`, `velobank`, `blik`, `noble_pay`, `ideabank`, `envelobank`, `santander_przelew24`, `nest_przelew`, `mbank_mtransfer`, `inteligo`, `pbac_z_ipko`, `bnp_paribas`, `credit_agricole`, `toyota_bank`, `bank_pekao_sa`, `volkswagen_bank`, `bank_millennium`, `alior_bank`, or `boz`.

columns.name: sofort_country
columns.comment: Two-letter ISO code representing the country the bank account is located in.

columns.name: ideal_transaction_id
columns.comment: Unique transaction ID generated by iDEAL.

columns.name: acss_debit_institution_number
columns.comment: Institution number of the bank account

columns.name: card_read_method
columns.comment: How card details were read in this transaction.

columns.name: alipay_transaction_id
columns.comment: Transaction ID of this particular Alipay transaction.

columns.name: acss_debit_last4
columns.comment: Last four digits of the bank account number.

columns.name: card_network
columns.comment: Identifies which network this charge was processed on. Can be `amex`, `cartes_bancaires`, `diners`, `discover`, `eftpos_au`, `interac`, `jcb`, `link`, `mastercard`, `unionpay`, `visa`, or `unknown`.

columns.name: giropay_bic
columns.comment: Bank Identifier Code of the bank associated with the bank account.

columns.name: konbini_store_chain
columns.comment: The name of the convenience store chain where the payment was completed.

columns.name: ideal_bank
columns.comment: The customer's bank, if provided. Can be one of `abn_amro`, `asn_bank`, `bunq`, `buut`, `finom`, `handelsbanken`, `ing`, `knab`, `mollie`, `moneyou`, `n26`, `nn`, `rabobank`, `regiobank`, `revolut`, `sns_bank`, `triodos_bank`, `van_lanschot`, or `yoursafe`.

columns.name: nz_bank_account_bank_name
columns.comment: The name of the bank.

columns.name: ach_debit_country
columns.comment: Two-letter ISO code representing the country the bank account is located in.

columns.name: swish_payment_reference
columns.comment: Payer bank reference number for the payment

columns.name: card_exp_month
columns.comment: Two-digit number representing the card's expiration month.

columns.name: payto_pay_id
columns.comment: The PayID alias for the bank account.

columns.name: multibanco_entity
columns.comment: Entity number associated with this Multibanco payment.

columns.name: sofort_bank_name
columns.comment: Name of the bank associated with the bank account.

columns.name: boleto_number
columns.comment: Boleto Number

columns.name: ideal_iban_last4
columns.comment: Last four characters of the IBAN.

columns.name: card_address_line1_check
columns.comment: If a address line1 was provided, results of the check, one of `pass`, `fail`, `unavailable`, or `unchecked`.

columns.name: bacs_debit_last4
columns.comment: Last four digits of the bank account number.

columns.name: alipay_fingerprint
columns.comment: Uniquely identifies this particular Alipay account. You can use this attribute to check whether two Alipay accounts are the same.

columns.name: eps_verified_name
columns.comment:
Owner's verified full name. Values are verified or provided by EPS directly
(if supported) at the time of authorization or settlement. They cannot be set or mutated.
EPS rarely provides this information so the attribute is usually empty.

columns.name: card_wallet_apple_pay_type
columns.comment: Apple Pay type. Can be `apple_pay`, `apple_pay_later` or `unknown`.

columns.name: ideal_generated_sepa_debit_id
columns.comment: The ID of the SEPA Direct Debit PaymentMethod which was generated by this Charge.

columns.name: sofort_verified_name
columns.comment:
Owner's verified full name. Values are verified or provided by SOFORT directly
(if supported) at the time of authorization or settlement. They cannot be set or mutated.

columns.name: card_fingerprint
columns.comment:
Uniquely identifies this particular card number. You can use this attribute to check whether two customers who’ve signed up with you are using the same card number, for example. For payment methods that tokenize card information (Apple Pay, Google Pay), the tokenized number might be provided instead of the underlying card number.

*As of May 1, 2021, card fingerprint in India for Connect changed to allow two fingerprints for the same card---one for India and one for the rest of the world.*

columns.name: card_brand
columns.comment: Card brand. Can be `amex`, `cartes_bancaires`, `diners`, `discover`, `eftpos_au`, `jcb`, `link`, `mastercard`, `unionpay`, `visa` or `unknown`.

columns.name: au_becs_debit_fingerprint
columns.comment: Uniquely identifies this particular bank account. You can use this attribute to check whether two bank accounts are the same.

columns.name: card_brand_product
columns.comment: The [product code](https://stripe.com/docs/card-product-codes) that identifies the specific program or product associated with a card.

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: payto_bsb_number

columns.name: acss_debit_transit_number
columns.comment: Transit number of the bank account.

columns.name: swish_fingerprint
columns.comment: Uniquely identifies the payer's Swish account. You can use this attribute to check whether two Swish transactions were paid for by the same payer

columns.name: us_bank_account_fingerprint
columns.comment: Uniquely identifies this particular bank account. You can use this attribute to check whether two bank accounts are the same.

columns.name: payto_account_number
columns.comment: The account number for the bank account.

columns.name: us_bank_account_bank_name
columns.comment: The name of the bank.

columns.name: ideal_bic

columns.name: card_generated_card
columns.comment: ID of a card PaymentMethod generated from the card_present PaymentMethod that may be attached to a Customer for future transactions. Only present if it was possible to generate a card PaymentMethod.

columns.name: sofort_preferred_language

columns.name: fpx_bank
columns.comment: The customer's bank. columns.name: us_bank_account_last4
columns.comment: Last four digits of the bank account number.

columns.comment: Sort code of the bank account. (e.g., `10-20-30`)

columns.comment: The name on the bank account. Only required if the account holder name is different from the name of the authorized signatory collected in the PaymentMethod’s billing details.

columns.comment:
Preferred language of the Klarna authorization page that the customer is redirected to.
Can be one of `de-AT`, `en-AT`, `nl-BE`, `fr-BE`, `en-BE`, `de-DE`, `en-DE`, `da-DK`, `en-DK`, `es-ES`, `en-ES`, `fi-FI`, `sv-FI`, `en-FI`, `en-GB`, `en-IE`, `it-IT`, `en-IT`, `nl-NL`, `en-NL`, `nb-NO`, `en-NO`, `sv-SE`, `en-SE`, `en-US`, `es-US`, `fr-FR`, `en-FR`, `cs-CZ`, `en-CZ`, `ro-RO`, `en-RO`, `el-GR`, `en-GR`, `en-AU`, `en-NZ`, `en-CA`, `fr-CA`, `pl-PL`, `en-PL`, `pt-PT`, `en-PT`, `de-CH`, `fr-CH`, `it-CH`, or `en-CH`

columns.name: card_network_transaction_id
columns.comment: This is used by the financial networks to identify a transaction. Visa calls this the Transaction ID, Mastercard calls this the Trace ID, and American Express calls this the Acquirer Reference Data. This value will be present if it is returned by the financial network in the authorization response, and null otherwise.

columns.name: cashapp_buyer_id
columns.comment: A unique and immutable identifier assigned by Cash App to every buyer.

columns.name: sepa_debit_branch_code

columns.name: card_address_postal_code_check
columns.comment: If a address postal code was provided, results of the check, one of `pass`, `fail`, `unavailable`, or `unchecked`.

columns.name: boleto_expires_at
columns.comment: Boleto Expiration Timestamp (UTC)

columns.name: acss_debit_mandate_id
columns.comment: ID of the mandate used to make this payment.

columns.name: terminal_reader_id
columns.comment: ID of the [reader](/docs/api/terminal/readers) this transaction was made on.

columns.name: nz_bank_account_bank_code
columns.comment: The numeric code for the bank account's bank.

columns.name: card_installments_plan_interval
columns.comment:
For `fixed_count` installment plans, this is the interval between installment payments your customer will make to their credit card.
One of `month`.

columns.name: card_3ds_authenticated
columns.comment: Whether or not authentication was performed. 3D Secure will succeed without authentication when the card is not enrolled.

columns.name: card_installments_plan_count
columns.comment: For `fixed_count` installment plans, this is the number of installment payments your customer will make to their credit card.

columns.name: sepa_debit_fingerprint
columns.comment: Uniquely identifies this particular bank account. You can use this attribute to check whether two bank accounts are the same.

columns.comment: The customer's bank. Should be one of `arzte_und_apotheker_bank`, `austrian_anadi_bank_ag`, `bank_austria`, `bankhaus_carl_spangler`, `bankhaus_schelhammer_und_schattera_ag`, `bawag_psk_ag`, `bks_bank_ag`, `brull_kallmus_bank_ag`, `btv_vier_lander_bank`, `capital_bank_grawe_gruppe_ag`, `deutsche_bank_ag`, `dolomitenbank`, `easybank_ag`, `erste_bank_und_sparkassen`, `hypo_alpeadriabank_international_ag`, `hypo_noe_lb_fur_niederosterreich_u_wien`, `hypo_oberosterreich_salzburg_steiermark`, `hypo_tirol_bank_ag`, `hypo_vorarlberg_bank_ag`, `hypo_bank_burgenland_aktiengesellschaft`, `marchfelder_bank`, `oberbank_ag`, `raiffeisen_bankengruppe_osterreich`, `schoellerbank_ag`, `sparda_bank_wien`, `volksbank_gruppe`, `volkskreditbank_ag`, or `vr_bank_braunau`.

columns.name: card_country
columns.comment: Two-letter ISO code representing the country of the card. You could use this attribute to get a sense of the international breakdown of cards you've collected.

columns.name: p24_verified_name
columns.comment:
Owner's verified full name. Values are verified or provided by Przelewy24 directly
(if supported) at the time of authorization or settlement. They cannot be set or mutated.
Przelewy24 rarely provides this information so the attribute is usually empty.

columns.name: ach_debit_bank_name
columns.comment: Name of the bank associated with the bank account.

columns.name: ideal_generated_sepa_debit_mandate_id
columns.comment: The mandate for the SEPA Direct Debit PaymentMethod which was generated by this Charge.

columns.comment: Reference number associated with this Multibanco payment.

columns.comment: Bank code of bank associated with the bank account.

columns.comment: Bank code of bank associated with the bank account.

columns.name: ach_debit_account_holder_type
columns.comment: Type of entity that holds the account. This can be either `individual` or `company`.

columns.name: card_funding
columns.comment: Card funding type. Can be `credit`, `debit`, `prepaid`, or `unknown`.

columns.name: card_exp_year
columns.comment: Four-digit number representing the card's expiration year.

columns.name: card_network_token_used
columns.comment: Indicates if Stripe used a network token, either user provided or Stripe managed when processing the transaction

columns.comment: Last four characters of the IBAN.

columns.comment: A unique and immutable identifier of payments assigned by Cash App
