tables.name: accounts
tables.comment: This is an object that represents a Stripe account.

columns.name: support_email
columns.comment: A publicly shareable support email address for the business.

columns.name: legal_entity_address_postal_code
columns.comment: ZIP or postal code.

columns.name: capabilities_au_becs_debit_payments
columns.comment: The status of the BECS Direct Debit (AU) payments capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process BECS Direct Debit (AU) charges.

columns.name: legal_entity_address_state
columns.comment: State, county, province, or region.

columns.name: capabilities_zip_payments
columns.comment: The status of the Zip capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process Zip charges.

columns.name: legal_entity_address_kanji_line1
columns.comment: Address line 1, such as the street, PO Box, or company name.

columns.name: payout_schedule_delay_days
columns.comment: The number of days charges for the account will be held before being paid out.

columns.name: decline_charge_on_cvc_failure
columns.comment: Whether Stripe automatically declines charges with an incorrect CVC. This setting only applies when a CVC is provided and it fails bank verification.

columns.name: capabilities_us_bank_account_ach_payments
columns.comment: The status of the US bank account ACH payments capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process US bank account charges.

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_kanji_line2
columns.comment: Address line 2, such as the apartment, suite, unit, or building.

columns.name: legal_entity_first_name
columns.comment: The first name of the individual responsible for the account.

columns.name: capabilities_p24_payments
columns.comment: The status of the P24 payments capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process P24 charges.

columns.name: capabilities_eps_payments
columns.comment: The status of the EPS payments capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process EPS charges.

columns.name: debit_negative_balances
columns.comment: A Boolean indicating if Stripe should try to reclaim negative balances from an attached bank account. See our [Understanding Connect Account Balances](/docs/connect/account-balances) documentation for details.

columns.name: capabilities_revolut_pay_payments
columns.comment: The status of the RevolutPay capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process RevolutPay payments.

columns.name: business_name
columns.comment: The publicly visible name of the business.

columns.name: legal_entity_maiden_name
columns.comment: The maiden name of the individual responsible for the account.

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_line2
columns.comment: Address line 2, such as the apartment, suite, unit, or building.

columns.name: payout_schedule_weekly_anchor
columns.comment: The day of the week funds will be paid out, of the style 'monday', 'tuesday', etc. Only shown if `interval` is weekly.

columns.name: capabilities_cashapp_payments
columns.comment: The status of the Cash App Pay capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process Cash App Pay payments.

columns.name: capabilities_sofort_payments
columns.comment: The status of the Sofort payments capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process Sofort charges.

columns.name: controller_fees_payer
columns.comment: A value indicating the responsible payer of a bundle of Stripe fees for pricing-control eligible products on this account. Learn more about [fee behavior on connected accounts](https://docs.stripe.com/connect/direct-charges-fee-payer-behavior).

columns.name: capabilities_cartes_bancaires_payments
columns.comment: The status of the Cartes Bancaires payments capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process Cartes Bancaires card charges in EUR currency.

columns.name: capabilities_tax_reporting_us_1099_k
columns.comment: The status of the tax reporting 1099-K (US) capability of the account.

columns.name: details_submitted
columns.comment: Whether account details have been submitted. Accounts with Stripe Dashboard access, which includes Standard accounts, cannot receive payouts before this is true. Accounts where this is false should be directed to [an onboarding flow](/connect/onboarding) to finish submitting account details.

columns.name: email
columns.comment: An email address associated with the account. It's not used for authentication and Stripe doesn't market to this field without explicit approval from the platform.

columns.name: legal_entity_ssn_last_4_provided
columns.comment: Whether the last 4 ssn digits of the individual responsible for the account have been provided.

columns.name: capabilities_amazon_pay_payments
columns.comment: The status of the AmazonPay capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process AmazonPay payments.

columns.name: legal_entity_address_kana_postal_code
columns.comment: ZIP or postal code.

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_kanji_postal_code
columns.comment: ZIP or postal code.

columns.name: capabilities_boleto_payments
columns.comment: The status of the boleto payments capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process boleto charges.

columns.name: tos_acceptance_date
columns.comment: The Unix timestamp marking when the account representative accepted their service agreement

columns.name: tos_acceptance_user_agent
columns.comment: The user agent of the browser from which the account representative accepted their service agreement

columns.name: charges_enabled
columns.comment: Whether the account can process charges.

columns.name: capabilities_fpx_payments
columns.comment: The status of the FPX payments capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process FPX charges.

columns.name: legal_entity_first_name_kanji
columns.comment: The Kanji variation of the first name of the individual responsible for the account (Japan only).

columns.name: legal_entity_business_name_kana
columns.comment: The Kana variation of the company's legal name (Japan only).

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_kanji_line1
columns.comment: Address line 1, such as the street, PO Box, or company name.

columns.name: controller_requirement_collection
columns.comment: A value indicating responsibility for collecting requirements on this account. Only returned when the Connect application retrieving the resource controls the account.

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_kana_line1
columns.comment: Address line 1, such as the street, PO Box, or company name.

columns.name: payout_schedule_interval
columns.comment: How frequently funds will be paid out. One of `manual` (payouts only created via API call), `daily`, `weekly`, or `monthly`.

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_kana_state
columns.comment: State, county, province, or region.

columns.name: future_requirements_eventually_due
columns.comment: Fields that need to be collected assuming all volume thresholds are reached. As they become required, they appear in `currently_due` as well.

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_postal_code
columns.comment: ZIP or postal code.

columns.name: timezone
columns.comment: The timezone used in the Stripe Dashboard for this account. A list of possible time zone values is maintained at the [IANA Time Zone Database](http://www.iana.org/time-zones).

columns.name: capabilities_klarna_payments
columns.comment: The status of the Klarna payments capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process Klarna charges.

columns.name: legal_entity_verification_details
columns.comment: A user-displayable string describing the verification state for the person. For example, this may say "Provided identity information could not be verified".

columns.name: display_name
columns.comment: The display name for this account. This is used on the Stripe Dashboard to differentiate between accounts.

columns.name: legal_entity_dob_month
columns.comment: The month of birth, between 1 and 12.

columns.name: capabilities_link_payments
columns.comment: The status of the link_payments capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process Link charges.

columns.name: legal_entity_business_name
columns.comment: The company's legal name.

columns.name: controller_losses_payments
columns.comment: A value indicating who is liable when this account can't pay back negative balances from payments.

columns.name: legal_entity_gender
columns.comment: The gender of the individual responsible for the account.

columns.name: legal_entity_address_kana_line1
columns.comment: Address line 1, such as the street, PO Box, or company name.

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: controller_stripe_dashboard_type
columns.comment: A value indicating the Stripe dashboard this account has access to independent of the Connect application.

columns.name: legal_entity_address_kanji_city
columns.comment: City, district, suburb, town, or village.

columns.name: legal_entity_verification_status
columns.comment: The state of verification for the person. Possible values are `unverified`, `pending`, or `verified`. Please refer [guide](/docs/connect/handling-api-verification) to handle verification updates.

columns.name: capabilities_legacy_payments
columns.comment: The status of the legacy payments capability of the account.

columns.name: business_profile_mcc
columns.comment: [The merchant category code for the account](https://stripe.com/docs/connect/setting-mcc). MCCs are used to classify businesses based on the goods or services they provide.

columns.name: verification_due_by
columns.comment: By what time the `fields_needed` must be provided. If this date is in the past, the account is already in bad standing, and providing `fields_needed` is necessary to re-enable payouts and prevent other consequences. If this date is in the future, `fields_needed` must be provided to ensure the account remains in good standing.

columns.name: capabilities_konbini_payments
columns.comment: The status of the konbini payments capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process konbini charges.

columns.name: capabilities_blik_payments
columns.comment: The status of the blik payments capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process blik charges.

columns.name: requirements_currently_due
columns.comment: Fields that need to be collected to keep the account enabled. If not collected by `current_deadline`, these fields appear in `past_due` as well, and the account is disabled.

columns.name: legal_entity_first_name_kana
columns.comment: The Kana variation of the first name of the individual responsible for the account (Japan only).

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_kanji_country
columns.comment: Two-letter country code ([ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2)).

columns.name: country
columns.comment: The account's country.

columns.name: tos_acceptance_ip

columns.name: decline_charge_on_avs_failure
columns.comment: Whether Stripe automatically declines charges with an incorrect ZIP or postal code. This setting only applies when a ZIP or postal code is provided and they fail bank verification.

columns.name: legal_entity_address_kanji_country

columns.name: capabilities_bancontact_payments
columns.comment: The status of the Bancontact payments capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process Bancontact charges.

columns.name: legal_entity_tax_id_registrar
columns.comment: The jurisdiction in which the `business_tax_id` is registered (Germany-based companies only).

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_kanji_city

columns.name: legal_entity_address_line2
columns.comment: Address line 2, such as the apartment, suite, unit, or building.

columns.name: legal_entity_dob_year
columns.comment: The four-digit year of birth.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: default_currency
columns.comment: Three-letter ISO currency code representing the default currency for the account. This must be a currency that [Stripe supports in the account's country](https://stripe.com/docs/payouts).

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_id_number_provided
columns.comment: Whether the personal ID number of the individual responsible for the account was provided.

columns.name: capabilities_sepa_debit_payments
columns.comment: The status of the SEPA Direct Debits payments capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process SEPA Direct Debits charges.

columns.name: legal_entity_address_kana_line2
columns.comment: Address line 2, such as the apartment, suite, unit, or building.

columns.name: statement_descriptor
columns.comment: The default text that appears on credit card statements when a charge is made [directly on the account](/docs/connect/direct-charges).

columns.name: capabilities_card_payments
columns.comment: The status of the card payments capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process credit and debit card charges.

columns.name: legal_entity_verification_details_code
columns.comment: A machine-readable code specifying the verification state for this legal entity. One of `scan_corrupt`, `scan_not_readable`, `scan_failed_greyscale`, `scan_not_uploaded`, `scan_id_type_not_supported`, `scan_id_country_not_supported`, `scan_failed_other`, or `scan_failed_test_mode`.

columns.name: requirements_past_due
columns.comment: Fields that weren't collected by `current_deadline`. These fields need to be collected to enable the account.

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_kana_city
columns.comment: City, district, suburb, town, or village.

columns.name: legal_entity_verification_document_id
columns.comment: (ID of a [file upload](https://stripe.com/docs/guides/file-upload)) A photo (jpg or png) of the front of an identifying document, either a passport or local ID card.

columns.name: support_phone
columns.comment: A publicly shareable support phone number for the business.

columns.name: legal_entity_business_tax_id_provided
columns.comment: Whether the business ID number of the legal entity was provided.

columns.name: business_url
columns.comment: The publicly visible website of the business.

columns.name: legal_entity_last_name_kana
columns.comment: The Kana variation of the last name of the individual responsible for the account (Japan only).

columns.name: capabilities_twint_payments
columns.comment: The status of the TWINT capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process TWINT charges.

columns.name: legal_entity_address_kanji_state
columns.comment: State, county, province, or region.

columns.name: capabilities_swish_payments
columns.comment: The status of the Swish capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process Swish payments.

columns.name: capabilities_bacs_debit_payments
columns.comment: The status of the Bacs Direct Debits payments capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process Bacs Direct Debits charges.

columns.name: requirements_eventually_due
columns.comment: Fields that need to be collected assuming all volume thresholds are reached. As they become required, they appear in `currently_due` as well, and `current_deadline` becomes set.

columns.name: legal_entity_last_name
columns.comment: The last name of the individual responsible for the account.

columns.name: legal_entity_address_kana_state
columns.comment: State, county, province, or region.

columns.name: capabilities_multibanco_payments
columns.comment: The status of the Multibanco payments capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process Multibanco charges.

columns.name: capabilities_grabpay_payments
columns.comment: The status of the GrabPay payments capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process GrabPay charges.

columns.name: payout_schedule_monthly_anchor
columns.comment: The day of the month funds will be paid out. Only shown if `interval` is monthly. Payouts scheduled between the 29th and 31st of the month are sent on the last day of shorter months.

columns.name: capabilities_paynow_payments
columns.comment: The status of the paynow payments capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process paynow charges.

columns.name: requirements_current_deadline
columns.comment: Date by which the fields in `currently_due` must be collected to keep the account enabled. These fields may disable the account sooner if the next threshold is reached before they are collected.

columns.name: capabilities_tax_reporting_us_1099_misc
columns.comment: The status of the tax reporting 1099-MISC (US) capability of the account.

columns.name: legal_entity_last_name_kanji
columns.comment: The Kanji variation of the last name of the individual responsible for the account (Japan only).

columns.name: legal_entity_business_vat_id_provided
columns.comment: Whether the business VAT number of the legal entity was provided.

columns.name: capabilities_jcb_payments
columns.comment: The status of the JCB payments capability of the account, or whether the account (Japan only) can directly process JCB credit card charges in JPY currency.

columns.name: capabilities_oxxo_payments
columns.comment: The status of the OXXO payments capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process OXXO charges.

columns.name: type
columns.comment: The Stripe account type. Can be `standard`, `express`, `custom`, or `none`.

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_city
columns.comment: City, district, suburb, town, or village.

columns.name: capabilities_india_international_payments
columns.comment: The status of the india_international_payments capability of the account, or whether the account can process international charges (non INR) in India.

columns.name: verification_fields_needed
columns.comment: Field names that need to be provided for the account to remain in good standing. Nested fields are separated by `.` (for example, `legal_entity.first_name`).

columns.name: legal_entity_address_kanji_postal_code
columns.comment: ZIP or postal code.

columns.name: capabilities_bank_transfer_payments
columns.comment: The status of the customer_balance payments capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process customer_balance charges.

columns.name: capabilities_acss_debit_payments
columns.comment: The status of the Canadian pre-authorized debits payments capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process Canadian pre-authorized debits charges.

columns.name: future_requirements_current_deadline
columns.comment: Date on which `future_requirements` becomes the main `requirements` hash and `future_requirements` becomes empty. After the transition, `currently_due` requirements may immediately become `past_due`, but the account may also be given a grace period depending on its enablement state prior to transitioning.

columns.name: capabilities_mobilepay_payments
columns.comment: The status of the MobilePay capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process MobilePay charges.

columns.name: payouts_enabled
columns.comment: Whether the funds in this account can be paid out.

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_line1
columns.comment: Address line 1, such as the street, PO Box, or company name.

columns.name: capabilities_transfers
columns.comment: The status of the transfers capability of the account, or whether your platform can transfer funds to the account.

columns.name: legal_entity_type
columns.comment: Either "individual" or "company", for what kind of legal entity the account owner is for.

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_kana_country
columns.comment: Two-letter country code ([ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2)).

columns.name: legal_entity_address_city
columns.comment: City, district, suburb, town, or village.

columns.name: capabilities_affirm_payments
columns.comment: The status of the Affirm capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process Affirm charges.

columns.name: verification_disabled_reason
columns.comment: If the account is disabled, this string describes why the account can’t create charges or receive payouts. Can be `rejected.fraud`, `rejected.terms_of_service`, `rejected.listed`, `rejected.other`, `fields_needed`, `listed`, `under_review`, or `other`.

columns.name: legal_entity_address_kana_country
columns.comment: Two-letter country code ([ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2)).

columns.name: legal_entity_address_line1
columns.comment: Address line 1, such as the street, PO Box, or company name.

columns.name: legal_entity_business_name_kanji
columns.comment: The Kanji variation of the company's legal name (Japan only).

columns.name: legal_entity_address_kana_city
columns.comment: City, district, suburb, town, or village.

columns.name: legal_entity_address_country
columns.comment: Two-letter country code ([ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2)).

columns.name: capabilities_giropay_payments
columns.comment: The status of the giropay payments capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process giropay charges.

columns.name: future_requirements_currently_due
columns.comment: Fields that need to be collected to keep the account enabled. If not collected by `future_requirements[current_deadline]`, these fields will transition to the main `requirements` hash.

columns.name: capabilities_afterpay_clearpay_payments
columns.comment: The status of the Afterpay Clearpay capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process Afterpay Clearpay charges.

columns.name: legal_entity_phone_number
columns.comment: The company's phone number, used for verification.

columns.name: payout_statement_descriptor
columns.comment: The text that appears on the bank account statement for payouts. If not set, this defaults to the platform's bank descriptor as set in the Dashboard.

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_kana_line2

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_country
columns.comment: Two-letter country code ([ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2)).

columns.name: future_requirements_past_due
columns.comment: Fields that weren't collected by `requirements.current_deadline`. These fields need to be collected to enable the capability on the account. New fields will never appear here; `future_requirements.past_due` will always be a subset of `requirements.past_due`.

columns.name: capabilities_promptpay_payments
columns.comment: The status of the promptpay payments capability of the account, or whether the account can directly process promptpay charges.

columns.name: capabilities_card_issuing
columns.comment: The status of the card issuing capability of the account, or whether you can use Issuing to distribute funds on cards

tables.name: balance_transactions
tables.comment: This is an object representing transactions that contributed to your Stripe account balance.

columns.name: available_on
columns.comment: The date that the transaction's net funds become available in the Stripe balance.

columns.name: description
columns.comment: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

columns.name: automatic_transfer_id
columns.comment: ID of the automatically created transfer associated with this balance transaction (only set if your account is on an [automatic payout schedule](https://stripe.com/docs/payouts#payout-schedule)).

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: net
columns.comment: Net impact to a Stripe balance (in cents). A positive value represents incrementing a Stripe balance, and a negative value decrementing a Stripe balance. You can calculate the net impact of a transaction on a balance by `amount` - `fee`

columns.name: amount
columns.comment: Gross amount of this transaction (in cents). A positive value represents funds charged to another party, and a negative value represents funds sent to another party.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: status
columns.comment: The transaction's net funds status in the Stripe balance, which are either `available` or `pending`.

columns.name: source_id
columns.comment: This transaction relates to the Stripe object.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: reporting_category
columns.comment: A new categorization of balance transactions, meant to improve on the current `type` field. [Learn more](https://stripe.com/docs/reports/reporting-categories). Please let us know what would be most helpful using the **Feedback** link at the bottom of this page.

columns.name: type
columns.comment: Transaction type: `adjustment`, `advance`, `advance_funding`, `anticipation_repayment`, `application_fee`, `application_fee_refund`, `charge`, `climate_order_purchase`, `climate_order_refund`, `connect_collection_transfer`, `contribution`, `issuing_authorization_hold`, `issuing_authorization_release`, `issuing_dispute`, `issuing_transaction`, `obligation_outbound`, `obligation_reversal_inbound`, `payment`, `payment_failure_refund`, `payment_network_reserve_hold`, `payment_network_reserve_release`, `payment_refund`, `payment_reversal`, `payment_unreconciled`, `payout`, `payout_cancel`, `payout_failure`, `payout_minimum_balance_hold`, `payout_minimum_balance_release`, `refund`, `refund_failure`, `reserve_transaction`, `reserved_funds`, `stripe_fee`, `stripe_fx_fee`, `stripe_balance_payment_debit`, `stripe_balance_payment_debit_reversal`, `tax_fee`, `topup`, `topup_reversal`, `transfer`, `transfer_cancel`, `transfer_failure`, or `transfer_refund`. Learn more about [balance transaction types and what they represent](https://stripe.com/docs/reports/balance-transaction-types). To classify transactions for accounting purposes, consider `reporting_category` instead.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: fee
columns.comment: Fees (in cents) paid for this transaction. Represented as a positive integer when assessed.

tables.name: customers
tables.comment: Customer objects allow you to perform recurring charges and track multiple charges that are associated with the same customer.

columns.name: address_city
columns.comment: City, district, suburb, town, or village.

columns.name: discount_coupon_id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: invoice_settings_default_payment_method_id
columns.comment: ID of a payment method that's attached to the customer, to be used as the customer's default payment method for subscriptions and invoices.

columns.name: tax_exempt
columns.comment: Describes the customer's tax exemption status, which is `none`, `exempt`, or `reverse`. When set to `reverse`, invoice and receipt PDFs include the following text: **"Reverse charge"**.

columns.name: name
columns.comment: The customer's full name or business name.

columns.name: discount_subscription
columns.comment: The subscription that this coupon is applied to, if it is applied to a particular subscription.

columns.name: discount_start
columns.comment: Date that the coupon was applied.

columns.name: discount_invoice
columns.comment: The invoice that the discount's coupon was applied to, if it was applied directly to a particular invoice.

columns.name: sources_data_id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: shipping_address_line2
columns.comment: Address line 2, such as the apartment, suite, unit, or building.

columns.name: email
columns.comment: The customer's email address.

columns.name: default_source_id
columns.comment:
ID of the default payment source for the customer.

If you use payment methods created through the PaymentMethods API, see the [invoice_settings.default_payment_method](/docs/api/customers/object#customer_object-invoice_settings-default_payment_method) field instead.

columns.name: tax_ip_address
columns.comment: A recent IP address of the customer used for tax reporting and tax location inference.

columns.name: preferred_locales
columns.comment: The customer's preferred locales (languages), ordered by preference.

columns.name: description
columns.comment: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

columns.name: shipping_address_state
columns.comment: State, county, province, or region ([ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2)).

columns.name: discount_schedule_id
columns.comment: The subscription schedule that this coupon is applied to, if it is applied to a particular subscription schedule.

columns.name: address_postal_code
columns.comment: ZIP or postal code.

columns.name: shipping_address_postal_code
columns.comment: ZIP or postal code.

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: shipping_address_line1
columns.comment: Address line 1, such as the street, PO Box, or company name.

columns.name: balance
columns.comment: The current balance, if any, that's stored on the customer. If negative, the customer has credit to apply to their next invoice. If positive, the customer has an amount owed that's added to their next invoice. The balance only considers amounts that Stripe hasn't successfully applied to any invoice. It doesn't reflect unpaid invoices. This balance is only taken into account after invoices finalize.

columns.name: discount_invoice_item
columns.comment: The invoice item `id` (or invoice line item `id` for invoice line items of type='subscription') that the discount's coupon was applied to, if it was applied directly to a particular invoice item or invoice line item.

columns.name: tax_info_tax_id
columns.comment: The customer's tax ID number.

columns.name: discount_subscription_item
columns.comment: The subscription item that this coupon is applied to, if it is applied to a particular subscription item.

columns.name: address_state
columns.comment: State, county, province, or region ([ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2)).

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: invoice_credit_balance
columns.comment: The current multi-currency balances, if any, that's stored on the customer. If positive in a currency, the customer has a credit to apply to their next invoice denominated in that currency. If negative, the customer has an amount owed that's added to their next invoice denominated in that currency. These balances don't apply to unpaid invoices. They solely track amounts that Stripe hasn't successfully applied to any invoice. Stripe only applies a balance in a specific currency to an invoice after that invoice (which is in the same currency) finalizes.

columns.name: address_country
columns.comment: Two-letter country code ([ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2)).

columns.name: shipping_name
columns.comment: Customer name.

columns.name: shipping_address_city
columns.comment: City, district, suburb, town, or village.

columns.name: shipping_phone
columns.comment: Customer phone (including extension).

columns.name: tax_info_type
columns.comment: The type of ID number.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO code for the currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies) the customer can be charged in for recurring billing purposes.

columns.name: discount_end
columns.comment: If the coupon has a duration of `repeating`, the date that this discount will end. If the coupon has a duration of `once` or `forever`, this attribute will be null.

columns.name: address_line2
columns.comment: Address line 2, such as the apartment, suite, unit, or building.

columns.name: discount_promotion_code_id
columns.comment: The promotion code applied to create this discount.

columns.name: discount_customer_id
columns.comment: The ID of the customer associated with this discount.

columns.name: account_balance
columns.comment: This field has been renamed to `balance` and will be removed in a future API version.

columns.name: delinquent
columns.comment:
Tracks the most recent state change on any invoice belonging to the customer. Paying an invoice or marking it uncollectible via the API will set this field to false. An automatic payment failure or passing the `invoice.due_date` will set this field to `true`.

If an invoice becomes uncollectible by [dunning](/docs/billing/automatic-collection), `delinquent` doesn't reset to `false`.

If you care whether the customer has paid their most recent subscription invoice, use `subscription.status` instead. Paying or marking uncollectible any customer invoice regardless of whether it is the latest invoice for a subscription will always set this field to `false`.

columns.name: address_line1
columns.comment: Address line 1, such as the street, PO Box, or company name.

columns.name: phone
columns.comment: The customer's phone number.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: shipping_address_country
columns.comment: Two-letter country code ([ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2)).

columns.name: discount_checkout_session
columns.comment: The Checkout session that this coupon is applied to, if it is applied to a particular session in payment mode. Will not be present for subscription mode.

tables.name: disputes
tables.comment: A dispute occurs when a customer questions your charge with their bank or credit card company.

columns.name: evidence_details_has_evidence
columns.comment: Whether evidence has been staged for this dispute.

columns.name: evidence_cancellation_rebuttal
columns.comment: A justification for why the customer's subscription was not canceled.

columns.name: evidence_details_past_due
columns.comment: Whether the last evidence submission was submitted past the due date. Defaults to `false` if no evidence submissions have occurred. If `true`, then delivery of the latest evidence is *not* guaranteed.

columns.name: evidence_refund_policy_id
columns.comment: (ID of a [file upload](https://stripe.com/docs/guides/file-upload)) Your refund policy, as shown to the customer.

columns.name: evidence_shipping_carrier
columns.comment: The delivery service that shipped a physical product, such as Fedex, UPS, USPS, etc. If multiple carriers were used for this purchase, please separate them with commas.

columns.name: network_details_visa_rapid_dispute_resolution
columns.comment: Whether this dispute was resolved via Visa's Rapid Dispute Resolution process.

columns.name: evidence_uncategorized_text
columns.comment: Any additional evidence or statements.

columns.name: evidence_product_description
columns.comment: A description of the product or service that was sold.

columns.name: evidence_shipping_address
columns.comment: The address to which a physical product was shipped. You should try to include as complete address information as possible.

columns.name: evidence_shipping_date
columns.comment: The date on which a physical product began its route to the shipping address, in a clear human-readable format.

columns.name: evidence_customer_communication_id
columns.comment: (ID of a [file upload](https://stripe.com/docs/guides/file-upload)) Any communication with the customer that you feel is relevant to your case. Examples include emails proving that the customer received the product or service, or demonstrating their use of or satisfaction with the product or service.

columns.name: evidence_billing_address
columns.comment: The billing address provided by the customer.

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: evidence_customer_email_address
columns.comment: The email address of the customer.

columns.name: evidence_refund_policy_disclosure
columns.comment: Documentation demonstrating that the customer was shown your refund policy prior to purchase.

columns.name: evidence_duplicate_charge_id
columns.comment: The Stripe ID for the prior charge which appears to be a duplicate of the disputed charge.

columns.name: reason
columns.comment: Reason given by cardholder for dispute. Possible values are `bank_cannot_process`, `check_returned`, `credit_not_processed`, `customer_initiated`, `debit_not_authorized`, `duplicate`, `fraudulent`, `general`, `incorrect_account_details`, `insufficient_funds`, `product_not_received`, `product_unacceptable`, `subscription_canceled`, or `unrecognized`. Learn more about [dispute reasons](/docs/disputes/categories).

columns.name: amount
columns.comment: Disputed amount. Usually the amount of the charge, but it can differ (usually because of currency fluctuation or because only part of the order is disputed).

columns.name: evidence_duplicate_charge_documentation_id
columns.comment: (ID of a [file upload](https://stripe.com/docs/guides/file-upload)) Documentation for the prior charge that can uniquely identify the charge, such as a receipt, shipping label, work order, etc. This document should be paired with a similar document from the disputed payment that proves the two payments are separate.

columns.name: evidence_customer_signature_id
columns.comment: (ID of a [file upload](https://stripe.com/docs/guides/file-upload)) A relevant document or contract showing the customer's signature.

columns.name: evidence_shipping_tracking_number
columns.comment: The tracking number for a physical product, obtained from the delivery service. If multiple tracking numbers were generated for this purchase, please separate them with commas.

columns.name: evidence_uncategorized_file_id
columns.comment: (ID of a [file upload](https://stripe.com/docs/guides/file-upload)) Any additional evidence or statements.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: evidence_customer_name
columns.comment: The name of the customer.

columns.name: evidence_refund_refusal_explanation
columns.comment: A justification for why the customer is not entitled to a refund.

columns.name: is_charge_refundable
columns.comment: If true, it's still possible to refund the disputed payment. After the payment has been fully refunded, no further funds are withdrawn from your Stripe account as a result of this dispute.

columns.name: evidence_details_submission_count
columns.comment: The number of times evidence has been submitted. Typically, you may only submit evidence once.

columns.name: evidence_customer_purchase_ip
columns.comment: The IP address that the customer used when making the purchase.

columns.name: status
columns.comment: Current status of dispute. Possible values are `warning_needs_response`, `warning_under_review`, `warning_closed`, `needs_response`, `under_review`, `won`, or `lost`.

columns.name: evidence_service_date
columns.comment: The date on which the customer received or began receiving the purchased service, in a clear human-readable format.

columns.name: evidence_service_documentation_id
columns.comment: (ID of a [file upload](https://stripe.com/docs/guides/file-upload)) Documentation showing proof that a service was provided to the customer. This could include a copy of a signed contract, work order, or other form of written agreement.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: evidence_cancellation_policy_disclosure
columns.comment: An explanation of how and when the customer was shown your refund policy prior to purchase.

columns.name: network_reason_code
columns.comment: Network-dependent reason code for the dispute.

columns.name: network_details_type
columns.comment: The network type for this dispute. There will be a corresponding hash of details keyed by the value of this field.

columns.name: evidence_access_activity_log
columns.comment: Any server or activity logs showing proof that the customer accessed or downloaded the purchased digital product. This information should include IP addresses, corresponding timestamps, and any detailed recorded activity.

columns.name: evidence_shipping_documentation_id
columns.comment: (ID of a [file upload](https://stripe.com/docs/guides/file-upload)) Documentation showing proof that a product was shipped to the customer at the same address the customer provided to you. This could include a copy of the shipment receipt, shipping label, etc. It should show the customer's full shipping address, if possible.

columns.name: evidence_cancellation_policy_id
columns.comment: (ID of a [file upload](https://stripe.com/docs/guides/file-upload)) Your subscription cancellation policy, as shown to the customer.

columns.name: evidence_details_due_by
columns.comment: Date by which evidence must be submitted in order to successfully challenge dispute. Will be 0 if the customer's bank or credit card company doesn't allow a response for this particular dispute.

columns.name: evidence_receipt_id
columns.comment: (ID of a [file upload](https://stripe.com/docs/guides/file-upload)) Any receipt or message sent to the customer notifying them of the charge.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: charge_id
columns.comment: ID of the charge that's disputed.

tables.name: refunds
tables.comment: Refund objects allow you to refund a charge that has previously been created but not yet refunded.

columns.name: failure_reason
columns.comment: Provides the reason for the refund failure. Possible values are: `lost_or_stolen_card`, `expired_or_canceled_card`, `charge_for_pending_refund_disputed`, `insufficient_funds`, `declined`, `merchant_request`, or `unknown`.

columns.name: refund_description
columns.comment: An arbitrary string attached to the object. You can use this for displaying to users (available on non-card refunds only).

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: source_transfer_reversal_id
columns.comment: The transfer reversal that's associated with the refund. Only present if the charge came from another Stripe account.

columns.name: balance_transaction_id
columns.comment: Balance transaction that describes the impact on your account balance.

columns.name: reason
columns.comment: Reason for the refund, which is either user-provided (`duplicate`, `fraudulent`, or `requested_by_customer`) or generated by Stripe internally (`expired_uncaptured_charge`).

columns.name: amount
columns.comment: Amount, in cents.

columns.name: failure_balance_transaction_id
columns.comment: After the refund fails, this balance transaction describes the adjustment made on your account balance that reverses the initial balance transaction.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: receipt_number
columns.comment: This is the transaction number that appears on email receipts sent for this refund.

columns.name: status
columns.comment: Status of the refund. This can be `pending`, `requires_action`, `succeeded`, `failed`, or `canceled`. Learn more about [failed refunds](/docs/refunds#failed-refunds).

columns.name: refund_transfer_reversal_id
columns.comment: This refers to the transfer reversal object if the accompanying transfer reverses. This is only applicable if the charge was created using the destination parameter.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: refund_payment_intent
columns.comment: ID of the PaymentIntent that's refunded.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: charge_id
columns.comment: ID of the charge that's refunded.

tables.name: external_account_bank_accounts
tables.comment: This is an object that represents an external bank account.

columns.name: default_for_currency
columns.comment: Whether this bank account is the default external account for its currency.

columns.name: fingerprint
columns.comment: Uniquely identifies this particular bank account. You can use this attribute to check whether two bank accounts are the same.

columns.name: available_payout_methods
columns.comment: A set of available payout methods for this bank account. Only values from this set should be passed as the `method` when creating a payout.

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: country
columns.comment: Two-letter ISO code representing the country the bank account is located in.

columns.name: account_type
columns.comment: The bank account type. This can only be `checking` or `savings` in most countries. In Japan, this can only be `futsu` or `toza`.

columns.name: bank_name
columns.comment: Name of the bank associated with the routing number (e.g., `WELLS FARGO`).

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: last4
columns.comment: The last four digits of the bank account number.

columns.name: status
columns.comment:
For bank accounts, possible values are `new`, `validated`, `verified`, `verification_failed`, `tokenized_account_number_deactivated` or `errored`. A bank account that hasn't had any activity or validation performed is `new`. If Stripe can determine that the bank account exists, its status will be `validated`. Note that there often isn’t enough information to know (e.g., for smaller credit unions), and the validation is not always run. If customer bank account verification has succeeded, the bank account status will be `verified`. If the verification failed for any reason, such as microdeposit failure, the status will be `verification_failed`. If the status is `tokenized_account_number_deactivated`, the account utilizes a tokenized account number which has been deactivated due to expiration or revocation. This account will need to be reverified to continue using it for money movement. If a payout sent to this bank account fails, we'll set the status to `errored` and will not continue to send [scheduled payouts](https://stripe.com/docs/payouts#payout-schedule) until the bank details are updated.

For external accounts, possible values are `new`, `errored`, `verification_failed`, and `tokenized_account_number_deactivated`. If a payout fails, the status is set to `errored` and scheduled payouts are stopped until account details are updated. In the US and India, if we can't [verify the owner of the bank account](https://support.stripe.com/questions/bank-account-ownership-verification), we'll set the status to `verification_failed`. Other validations aren't run against external accounts because they're only used for payouts. This means the other statuses don't apply.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO code for the currency](https://stripe.com/docs/payouts) paid out to the bank account.

columns.name: account_holder_type
columns.comment: The type of entity that holds the account. This can be either `individual` or `company`.

columns.name: routing_number
columns.comment: The routing transit number for the bank account.

columns.name: account_holder_name
columns.comment: The name of the person or business that owns the bank account.

tables.name: external_account_cards
tables.comment: This is an object that represents an external account card.

columns.name: address_city
columns.comment: City/District/Suburb/Town/Village.

columns.name: default_for_currency
columns.comment: Whether this card is the default external account for its currency. This property is only available for accounts where [controller.requirement_collection](/api/accounts/object#account_object-controller-requirement_collection) is `application`, which includes Custom accounts.

columns.name: name
columns.comment: Cardholder name.

columns.name: fingerprint
columns.comment:
Uniquely identifies this particular card number. You can use this attribute to check whether two customers who’ve signed up with you are using the same card number, for example. For payment methods that tokenize card information (Apple Pay, Google Pay), the tokenized number might be provided instead of the underlying card number.

*As of May 1, 2021, card fingerprint in India for Connect changed to allow two fingerprints for the same card---one for India and one for the rest of the world.*

columns.name: customer_id
columns.comment: The customer that this card belongs to. This attribute will not be in the card object if the card belongs to an account or recipient instead.

columns.name: tokenization_method
columns.comment: If the card number is tokenized, this is the method that was used. Can be `android_pay` (includes Google Pay), `apple_pay`, `masterpass`, `visa_checkout`, or null.

columns.name: available_payout_methods
columns.comment: A set of available payout methods for this card. Only values from this set should be passed as the `method` when creating a payout.

columns.name: address_zip
columns.comment: ZIP or postal code.

columns.name: exp_month
columns.comment: Two-digit number representing the card's expiration month.

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: exp_year
columns.comment: Four-digit number representing the card's expiration year.

columns.name: country
columns.comment: Two-letter ISO code representing the country of the card. You could use this attribute to get a sense of the international breakdown of cards you've collected.

columns.name: brand
columns.comment: Card brand. Can be `American Express`, `Cartes Bancaires`, `Diners Club`, `Discover`, `Eftpos Australia`, `Girocard`, `JCB`, `MasterCard`, `UnionPay`, `Visa`, or `Unknown`.

columns.name: address_state
columns.comment: State/County/Province/Region.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: last4
columns.comment: The last four digits of the card.

columns.name: address_country
columns.comment: Billing address country, if provided when creating card.

columns.name: status
columns.comment: For external accounts that are cards, possible values are `new` and `errored`. If a payout fails, the status is set to `errored` and [scheduled payouts](https://stripe.com/docs/payouts#payout-schedule) are stopped until account details are updated.

columns.name: regulated_status
columns.comment: Status of a card based on the card issuer.

columns.name: allow_redisplay
columns.comment: This field indicates whether this payment method can be shown again to its customer in a checkout flow. Stripe products such as Checkout and Elements use this field to determine whether a payment method can be shown as a saved payment method in a checkout flow. The field defaults to “unspecified”.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO code for currency](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html) in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://docs.stripe.com/currencies). Only applicable on accounts (not customers or recipients). The card can be used as a transfer destination for funds in this currency. This property is only available for accounts where [controller.is_controller](/api/accounts/object#account_object-controller-is_controller) is `true`.

columns.name: funding
columns.comment: Card funding type. Can be `credit`, `debit`, `prepaid`, or `unknown`.

columns.name: address_line2
columns.comment: Address line 2 (Apartment/Suite/Unit/Building).

columns.name: address_line1
columns.comment: Address line 1 (Street address/PO Box/Company name).

columns.name: dynamic_last4
columns.comment: (For tokenized numbers only.) The last four digits of the device account number.

columns.name: cvc_check
columns.comment: If a CVC was provided, results of the check: `pass`, `fail`, `unavailable`, or `unchecked`. A result of unchecked indicates that CVC was provided but hasn't been checked yet. Checks are typically performed when attaching a card to a Customer object, or when creating a charge. For more details, see [Check if a card is valid without a charge](https://support.stripe.com/questions/check-if-a-card-is-valid-without-a-charge).

columns.name: address_zip_check
columns.comment: If `address_zip` was provided, results of the check: `pass`, `fail`, `unavailable`, or `unchecked`.

columns.name: address_line1_check
columns.comment: If `address_line1` was provided, results of the check: `pass`, `fail`, `unavailable`, or `unchecked`.

tables.name: coupons
tables.comment: A coupon contains information about a percent-off or amount-off discount you might want to apply to a customer. Coupons only apply to invoices; they do not apply to one-off charges.

columns.name: duration
columns.comment: One of `forever`, `once`, or `repeating`. Describes how long a customer who applies this coupon will get the discount.

columns.name: name
columns.comment: Name of the coupon displayed to customers on for instance invoices or receipts.

columns.name: percent_off
columns.comment: Percent that will be taken off the subtotal of any invoices for this customer for the duration of the coupon. For example, a coupon with percent_off of 50 will make a $100 invoice $50 instead.

columns.name: duration_in_months
columns.comment: If `duration` is `repeating`, the number of months the coupon applies. Null if coupon `duration` is `forever` or `once`.

columns.name: times_redeemed
columns.comment: Number of times this coupon has been applied to a customer.

columns.name: redeem_by
columns.comment: Date after which the coupon can no longer be redeemed.

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: valid
columns.comment: Taking account of the above properties, whether this coupon can still be applied to a customer.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: If `amount_off` has been set, the three-letter [ISO code for the currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies) of the amount to take off.

columns.name: amount_off
columns.comment: Amount (in the `currency` specified) that will be taken off the subtotal of any invoices for this customer.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: max_redemptions
columns.comment: Maximum number of times this coupon can be redeemed, in total, across all customers, before it is no longer valid.

columns.name: offered_terms_repayment_interval_configuration_duration_days

columns.name: offered_terms_repayment_interval_configuration_minimum_amount
columns.comment: Minimum amount that needs to be repaid in an interval. A positive integer representing the amount in the smallest currency unit (e.g. $12.34 would be represented as `1234`).

columns.name: paid_out_at

tables.name: invoice_items
tables.comment: Subscription invoice items allow you to add a charge or credit to a customer but only actually charge the customer's card at the end of a regular billing cycle.

columns.name: quantity
columns.comment: Quantity of units for the invoice item. If the invoice item is a proration, the quantity of the subscription that the proration was computed for.

columns.name: subscription_item
columns.comment: The subscription item that this invoice item has been created for, if any.

columns.name: customer_id
columns.comment: The ID of the customer who will be billed when this invoice item is billed.

columns.name: description
columns.comment: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

columns.name: price_id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: discountable
columns.comment: If true, discounts will apply to this invoice item. Always false for prorations.

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: amount
columns.comment: Amount (in the `currency` specified) of the invoice item. This should always be equal to `unit_amount * quantity`.

columns.name: unit_amount_decimal
columns.comment: Same as `unit_amount`, but contains a decimal value with at most 12 decimal places.

columns.name: period_start
columns.comment: The start of the period. This value is inclusive.

columns.name: proration
columns.comment: Whether the invoice item was created automatically as a proration adjustment when the customer switched plans.

columns.name: plan_id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: period_end
columns.comment: The end of the period, which must be greater than or equal to the start. This value is inclusive.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: date
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: discounts
columns.comment: The discounts which apply to the invoice item. Item discounts are applied before invoice discounts.

columns.name: net_amount
columns.comment: The amount after discounts, but before credits and taxes. This field is `null` for `discountable=true` items.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: subscription_id
columns.comment: The subscription that this invoice item has been created for, if any.

columns.name: unit_amount
columns.comment: Unit amount (in the `currency` specified) of the invoice item.

columns.name: invoice_id
columns.comment: The ID of the invoice this invoice item belongs to.

tables.name: invoice_payments
tables.comment: An Invoice Payment tracks the relationship between an invoice and its attached PaymentIntents.

columns.name: is_default
columns.comment: Stripe automatically creates a default InvoicePayment when the invoice is finalized, and keeps it synchronized with the invoice’s `amount_remaining`. The PaymentIntent associated with the default payment can’t be edited or canceled directly.

columns.name: amount_requested
columns.comment: Amount intended to be paid toward this invoice

columns.name: amount_overpaid
columns.comment: Excess payment that was received for this invoice and credited to the customer’s `invoice_credit_balance`. This field is null until the payment is `paid`. Overpayment can happen when you attach more than one PaymentIntent to the invoice, and each of them succeeds. To avoid overpayment, cancel any PaymentIntents that you do not need before attaching more.

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: invoice
columns.comment: The invoice that was paid.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: status
columns.comment: The status of the payment, one of `open`, `paid`, or `canceled`.

columns.name: status_transitions_paid_at
columns.comment: The time that the payment succeeded.

columns.name: amount_paid
columns.comment: Amount that was actually paid for this invoice. This field is null until the payment is `paid`. This amount can be less than the `amount_requested` if the PaymentIntent’s `amount_received` is not sufficient to pay all of the invoices that it is attached to.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: status_transitions_canceled_at
columns.comment: The time that the payment was canceled.

columns.name: payment_intent
columns.comment: ID of the PaymentIntent associated with this payment. Note: This property is only populated for invoices finalized on or after March 15th, 2019.

tables.name: issuing_authorizations

columns.name: merchant_currency
columns.comment: The local currency that was presented to the cardholder for the authorization. This currency can be different from the cardholder currency and the `currency` field on this authorization. Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: merchant_data_name
columns.comment: Name of the seller

columns.name: authorization_method

columns.name: merchant_data_postal_code

columns.name: verification_data_expiry_check
columns.comment: Whether the cardholder provided an expiry date and if it matched Stripe’s record.

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: verification_data_postal_code
columns.comment: The postal code submitted as part of the authorization used for postal code verification.

columns.comment: The total amount that was authorized or rejected. This amount is in `currency` and in the [smallest currency unit](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies#zero-decimal). `amount` should be the same as `merchant_amount`, unless `currency` and `merchant_currency` are different.

columns.name: id

columns.name: verification_data_cvc_check
columns.comment: Whether the cardholder provided a CVC and if it matched Stripe’s record.

columns.comment: The current status of the authorization in its lifecycle.

columns.name: card_id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: The currency of the cardholder. This currency can be different from the currency presented at authorization and the `merchant_currency` field on this authorization. Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: merchant_data_network_id

columns.comment: Two-letter country code ([ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2)).

columns.name: owner_address_city
columns.comment: City, district, suburb, town, or village.

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: code_verification_attempts_remaining
columns.comment: The number of attempts remaining to authenticate the source object with a verification code.

columns.name: owner_address_state
columns.comment: State, county, province, or region.

columns.name: owner_name
columns.comment: Owner's full name.

columns.name: redirect_url
columns.comment: The URL provided to you to redirect a customer to as part of a `redirect` authentication flow.

columns.name: owner_verified_phone
columns.comment: Verified owner's phone number (including extension). Verified values are verified or provided by the payment method directly (and if supported) at the time of authorization or settlement. They cannot be set or mutated.

columns.name: amount
columns.comment: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (that is, 100 cents for $1.00, or 1 for ¥1, Japanese Yen being a zero-decimal currency) representing the total amount associated with the source. This is the amount for which the source will be chargeable once ready. Required for `single_use` sources.

columns.name: receiver_address
columns.comment: The address of the receiver source. This is the value that should be communicated to the customer to send their funds to.

columns.name: owner_verified_address_state
columns.comment: State, county, province, or region.

columns.name: owner_verified_email
columns.comment: Verified owner's email address. Verified values are verified or provided by the payment method directly (and if supported) at the time of authorization or settlement. They cannot be set or mutated.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: owner_address_line2
columns.comment: Address line 2, such as the apartment, suite, unit, or building.

columns.name: flow
columns.comment: The authentication `flow` of the source. `flow` is one of `redirect`, `receiver`, `code_verification`, `none`.

columns.name: status
columns.comment: The status of the source, one of `canceled`, `chargeable`, `consumed`, `failed`, or `pending`. Only `chargeable` sources can be used to create a charge.

columns.name: owner_verified_address_city
columns.comment: City, district, suburb, town, or village.

columns.name: owner_phone
columns.comment: Owner's phone number (including extension).

columns.name: receiver_amount_charged
columns.comment: The total amount that was moved to your balance. This is almost always equal to the amount charged. In rare cases when customers deposit excess funds and we are unable to refund those, those funds get moved to your balance and show up in amount_charged as well. The amount charged is expressed in the source's currency.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO code for the currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies) associated with the source. This is the currency for which the source will be chargeable once ready. Required for `single_use` sources.

columns.name: receiver_amount_received
columns.comment: The total amount received by the receiver source. `amount_received = amount_returned + amount_charged` should be true for consumed sources unless customers deposit excess funds. The amount received is expressed in the source's currency.

columns.name: owner_address_postal_code
columns.comment: ZIP or postal code.

columns.name: redirect_failure_reason
columns.comment: The failure reason for the redirect, either `user_abort` (the customer aborted or dropped out of the redirect flow), `declined` (the authentication failed or the transaction was declined), or `processing_error` (the redirect failed due to a technical error). Present only if the redirect status is `failed`.

columns.name: client_secret
columns.comment: The client secret of the source. Used for client-side retrieval using a publishable key.

columns.name: code_verification_status
columns.comment: The status of the code verification, either `pending` (awaiting verification, `attempts_remaining` should be greater than 0), `succeeded` (successful verification) or `failed` (failed verification, cannot be verified anymore as `attempts_remaining` should be 0).

columns.name: receiver_amount_returned
columns.comment: The total amount that was returned to the customer. The amount returned is expressed in the source's currency.

columns.name: type
columns.comment: The `type` of the source. The `type` is a payment method, one of `ach_credit_transfer`, `ach_debit`, `alipay`, `bancontact`, `card`, `card_present`, `eps`, `giropay`, `ideal`, `multibanco`, `klarna`, `p24`, `sepa_debit`, `sofort`, `three_d_secure`, or `wechat`. An additional hash is included on the source with a name matching this value. It contains additional information specific to the [payment method](/docs/sources) used.

columns.name: owner_verified_address_postal_code
columns.comment: ZIP or postal code.

columns.name: redirect_return_url
columns.comment: The URL you provide to redirect the customer to after they authenticated their payment.

columns.name: owner_email
