tables.name: subscriptions
tables.comment: Subscriptions allow you to charge a customer's card on a recurring basis. A subscription ties a customer to a particular plan.

columns.name: pending_update_trial_end
columns.comment: Unix timestamp representing the end of the trial period the customer will get before being charged for the first time, if the update is applied.

columns.name: pending_update_expires_at
columns.comment: The point after which the changes reflected by this update will be discarded and no longer applied.

columns.name: trial_start
columns.comment: If the subscription has a trial, the beginning of that trial.

columns.name: discount_coupon_id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: payment_settings_payment_method_options_customer_balance_bank_transfer_eu_bank_transfer_country
columns.comment: The desired country code of the bank account information. Permitted values include: `BE`, `DE`, `ES`, `FR`, `IE`, or `NL`.

columns.name: payment_settings_payment_method_options_customer_balance_bank_transfer_type
columns.comment: The bank transfer type that can be used for funding. Permitted values include: `eu_bank_transfer`, `gb_bank_transfer`, `jp_bank_transfer`, `mx_bank_transfer`, or `us_bank_transfer`.

columns.name: discount_subscription
columns.comment: The subscription that this coupon is applied to, if it is applied to a particular subscription.

columns.name: quantity
columns.comment: The quantity of the plan to which the customer is subscribed. For example, if your plan is $10/user/month, and your customer has 5 users, you could pass 5 as the quantity to have the customer charged $50 (5 x $10) monthly. Only set if the subscription contains a single plan.

columns.name: discount_start
columns.comment: Date that the coupon was applied.

columns.name: application_fee_percent
columns.comment: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice total that will be transferred to the application owner's Stripe account.

columns.name: start_date
columns.comment: The backdated start date or initial created date.

columns.name: discount_invoice
columns.comment: The invoice that the discount's coupon was applied to, if it was applied directly to a particular invoice.

columns.name: tax_percent
columns.comment: If provided, each invoice created by this subscription will apply the tax rate, increasing the amount billed to the customer.

columns.name: payment_settings_payment_method_options_customer_balance_funding_type
columns.comment: The funding method type to be used when there are not enough funds in the customer balance. Permitted values include: `bank_transfer`.

columns.name: customer_id
columns.comment: ID of the customer who owns the subscription.

columns.name: billing_thresholds_amount_gte
columns.comment: Monetary threshold that triggers the subscription to create an invoice

columns.name: default_source_id
columns.comment: ID of the default payment source for the subscription. It must belong to the customer associated with the subscription and be in a chargeable state. If `default_payment_method` is also set, `default_payment_method` will take precedence. If neither are set, invoices will use the customer's [invoice_settings.default_payment_method](/docs/api/customers/object#customer_object-invoice_settings-default_payment_method) or [default_source](/docs/api/customers/object#customer_object-default_source).

columns.name: cancellation_reason_text
columns.comment: The customer provided reason for cancelling the subscription.

columns.name: payment_settings_payment_method_options_customer_balance_bank_transfer_id_bank_transfer_bank
columns.comment: The bank where the account is held.

columns.name: description
columns.comment: The subscription's description, meant to be displayable to the customer. Use this field to optionally store an explanation of the subscription for rendering in Stripe surfaces and certain local payment methods UIs.

columns.name: cancel_at_period_end
columns.comment: Whether this subscription will (if `status=active`) or did (if `status=canceled`) cancel at the end of the current billing period.

columns.name: price_id
columns.comment: Reference to the price the customer is subscribed to. Only set if the subscription contains a single price.

columns.name: payment_settings_save_default_payment_method
columns.comment: Configure whether Stripe updates `subscription.default_payment_method` when payment succeeds. Defaults to `off`.

columns.name: payment_settings_payment_method_options_card_network
columns.comment: Selected network to process this Subscription on. Depends on the available networks of the card attached to the Subscription. Can be only set confirm-time.

columns.name: discount_schedule_id
columns.comment: The subscription schedule that this coupon is applied to, if it is applied to a particular subscription schedule.

columns.name: pending_update_billing_cycle_anchor
columns.comment: If the update is applied, determines the date of the first full invoice, and, for plans with `month` or `year` intervals, the day of the month for subsequent invoices. The timestamp is in UTC format.

columns.name: automatic_tax_enabled
columns.comment: Whether Stripe automatically computes tax on this subscription.

columns.name: default_payment_method_id
columns.comment: ID of the default payment method for the subscription. It must belong to the customer associated with the subscription. This takes precedence over `default_source`. If neither are set, invoices will use the customer's [invoice_settings.default_payment_method](/docs/api/customers/object#customer_object-invoice_settings-default_payment_method) or [default_source](/docs/api/customers/object#customer_object-default_source).

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: current_period_start
columns.comment: Start of the current period that the subscription has been invoiced for. This field is deprecated starting on the `2025-03-31.basil` version, please use `current_period_start` on the items[] field instead

columns.name: transfer_data_destination_id
columns.comment: The account where funds from the payment will be transferred to upon payment success.

columns.name: cancellation_details_comment
columns.comment: Additional comments about why the user canceled the subscription, if the subscription was canceled explicitly by the user.

columns.name: trial_settings_end_behavior_missing_payment_method
columns.comment: Indicates how the subscription should change when the trial ends if the user did not provide a payment method.

columns.name: pending_setup_intent_id
columns.comment: You can use this [SetupIntent](/docs/api/setup_intents) to collect user authentication when creating a subscription without immediate payment or updating a subscription's payment method, allowing you to optimize for off-session payments. Learn more in the [SCA Migration Guide](/docs/billing/migration/strong-customer-authentication#scenario-2).

columns.name: pause_collection_resumes_at
columns.comment: The time after which the subscription will resume collecting payments.

columns.name: ended_at
columns.comment: If the subscription has ended, the date the subscription ended.

columns.name: pending_update_trial_from_plan
columns.comment: Indicates if a plan's `trial_period_days` should be applied to the subscription. Setting `trial_end` per subscription is preferred, and this defaults to `false`. Setting this flag to `true` together with `trial_end` is not allowed. See [Using trial periods on subscriptions](/docs/billing/subscriptions/trials) to learn more.

columns.name: cancel_at
columns.comment: A date in the future at which the subscription will automatically get canceled

columns.name: discount_invoice_item
columns.comment: The invoice item `id` (or invoice line item `id` for invoice line items of type='subscription') that the discount's coupon was applied to, if it was applied directly to a particular invoice item or invoice line item.

columns.name: billing_mode_type
columns.comment: Controls how prorations and invoices for subscriptions are calculated and orchestrated.

columns.name: pause_collection_behavior
columns.comment: The payment collection behavior for this subscription while paused. One of `keep_as_draft`, `mark_uncollectible`, or `void`.

columns.name: discount_subscription_item
columns.comment: The subscription item that this coupon is applied to, if it is applied to a particular subscription item.

columns.name: payment_settings_payment_method_options_card_mandate_options_amount
columns.comment: Amount to be charged for future payments.

columns.name: proration_discounts
columns.comment: Controls how invoices and invoice items display proration amounts and discount amounts. `itemized` means that amounts are gross and discount amounts are accurate; `included` means that amounts are net and discount amounts are zero. This field is only populated for `billing_mode=flexible` subscriptions.

columns.name: plan_id
columns.comment: Reference to the plan the customer is subscribed to. Only set if the subscription contains a single plan.

columns.name: pending_invoice_item_interval_count
columns.comment: The number of intervals between invoices. For example, `interval=month` and `interval_count=3` bills every 3 months. Maximum of one year interval allowed (1 year, 12 months, or 52 weeks).

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: cancellation_reason
columns.comment: One of the preconfigured cancellation reasons selected by the customer.

columns.name: schedule_id
columns.comment: The schedule attached to the subscription

columns.name: payment_settings_payment_method_options_bancontact_preferred_language
columns.comment: Preferred language of the Bancontact authorization page that the customer is redirected to.

columns.name: discounts
columns.comment: The discounts applied to the subscription. Subscription item discounts are applied before subscription discounts. Use `expand[]=discounts` to expand each discount.

columns.name: payment_settings_payment_method_options_card_mandate_options_description
columns.comment: A description of the mandate or subscription that is meant to be displayed to the customer.

columns.name: status
columns.comment:
Possible values are `incomplete`, `incomplete_expired`, `trialing`, `active`, `past_due`, `canceled`, `unpaid`, or `paused`. 

For `collection_method=charge_automatically` a subscription moves into `incomplete` if the initial payment attempt fails. A subscription in this status can only have metadata and default_source updated. Once the first invoice is paid, the subscription moves into an `active` status. If the first invoice is not paid within 23 hours, the subscription transitions to `incomplete_expired`. This is a terminal status, the open invoice will be voided and no further invoices will be generated. 

A subscription that is currently in a trial period is `trialing` and moves to `active` when the trial period is over. 

A subscription can only enter a `paused` status [when a trial ends without a payment method](/docs/billing/subscriptions/trials#create-free-trials-without-payment). A `paused` subscription doesn't generate invoices and can be resumed after your customer adds their payment method. The `paused` status is different from [pausing collection](/docs/billing/subscriptions/pause-payment), which still generates invoices and leaves the subscription's status unchanged. 

If subscription `collection_method=charge_automatically`, it becomes `past_due` when payment is required but cannot be paid (due to failed payment or awaiting additional user actions). Once Stripe has exhausted all payment retry attempts, the subscription will become `canceled` or `unpaid` (depending on your subscriptions settings). 

If subscription `collection_method=send_invoice` it becomes `past_due` when its invoice is not paid by the due date, and `canceled` or `unpaid` if it is still not paid by an additional deadline after that. Note that when a subscription has a status of `unpaid`, no subsequent invoices will be attempted (invoices will be created, but then immediately automatically closed). After receiving updated payment information from a customer, you may choose to reopen and pay their closed invoices.

columns.name: on_behalf_of_id
columns.comment: The account (if any) the charge was made on behalf of for charges associated with this subscription. See the [Connect documentation](/docs/connect/subscriptions#on-behalf-of) for details.

columns.name: trial_end
columns.comment: If the subscription has a trial, the end of that trial.

columns.name: transfer_data_amount_percent
columns.comment: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice total that will be transferred to the destination account. By default, the entire amount is transferred to the destination.

columns.name: payment_settings_payment_method_options_card_mandate_options_amount_type
columns.comment: One of `fixed` or `maximum`. If `fixed`, the `amount` param refers to the exact amount to be charged in future payments. If `maximum`, the amount charged can be up to the value passed for the `amount` param.

columns.name: pending_invoice_item_interval
columns.comment: Specifies invoicing frequency. Either `day`, `week`, `month` or `year`.

columns.name: next_pending_invoice_item_invoice
columns.comment: Specifies the approximate timestamp on which any pending invoice items will be billed according to the schedule provided at `pending_invoice_item_interval`.

columns.name: billing_mode_updated_at
columns.comment: Details on when the current billing_mode was adopted.

columns.name: latest_invoice_id
columns.comment: The most recent invoice this subscription has generated.

columns.name: discount_end
columns.comment: If the coupon has a duration of `repeating`, the date that this discount will end. If the coupon has a duration of `once` or `forever`, this attribute will be null.

columns.name: payment_settings_payment_method_options_us_bank_account_verification_method
columns.comment: Bank account verification method.

columns.name: billing
columns.comment: Either `charge_automatically`, or `send_invoice`. When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay this subscription at the end of the cycle using the default source attached to the customer. When sending an invoice, Stripe will email your customer an invoice with payment instructions and mark the subscription as `active`.

columns.name: start
columns.comment: This keeps track of how long the current plan configuration is active. May be different from start_date. The value of start is updated anytime that trial_end is updated (either to now or a different value that was previously set) even if no trial is being ended.

columns.name: payment_settings_payment_method_options_card_request_three_d_secure
columns.comment: We strongly recommend that you rely on our SCA Engine to automatically prompt your customers for authentication based on risk level and [other requirements](/docs/strong-customer-authentication). However, if you wish to request 3D Secure based on logic from your own fraud engine, provide this option. Read our guide on [manually requesting 3D Secure](/docs/payments/3d-secure/authentication-flow#manual-three-ds) for more information on how this configuration interacts with Radar and our SCA Engine.

columns.name: current_period_end
columns.comment: End of the current period that the subscription has been invoiced for. At the end of this period, a new invoice will be created. This field is deprecated starting on the `2025-03-31.basil` version, please use `current_period_end` on the items[] field instead

columns.name: payment_settings_payment_method_options_acss_debit_verification_method
columns.comment: Bank account verification method.

columns.name: discount_promotion_code_id
columns.comment: The promotion code applied to create this discount.

columns.name: billing_thresholds_reset_billing_cycle_anchor
columns.comment: Indicates if the `billing_cycle_anchor` should be reset when a threshold is reached. If true, `billing_cycle_anchor` will be updated to the date/time the threshold was last reached; otherwise, the value will remain unchanged. This value may not be `true` if the subscription contains items with plans that have `aggregate_usage=last_ever`.

columns.name: discount_customer_id
columns.comment: The ID of the customer associated with this discount.

columns.name: payment_settings_payment_method_options_acss_debit_mandate_options_transaction_type
columns.comment: Transaction type of the mandate.

columns.name: canceled_at
columns.comment: If the subscription has been canceled, the date of that cancellation. If the subscription was canceled with `cancel_at_period_end`, `canceled_at` will reflect the time of the most recent update request, not the end of the subscription period when the subscription is automatically moved to a canceled state.

columns.name: cancellation_details_reason
columns.comment: Why this subscription was canceled.

columns.name: cancellation_details_feedback
columns.comment: The customer submitted reason for why they canceled, if the subscription was canceled explicitly by the user.

columns.name: application_id
columns.comment: ID of the Connect Application that created the subscription.

columns.name: billing_cycle_anchor
columns.comment: The reference point that aligns future [billing cycle](/docs/subscriptions/billing-cycle) dates. It sets the day of week for `week` intervals, the day of month for `month` and `year` intervals, and the month of year for `year` intervals. The timestamp is in UTC format.

columns.name: days_until_due
columns.comment: Number of days a customer has to pay invoices generated by this subscription. This value will be `null` for subscriptions where `collection_method=charge_automatically`.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: discount_checkout_session
columns.comment: The Checkout session that this coupon is applied to, if it is applied to a particular session in payment mode. Will not be present for subscription mode.

If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. tables.name: tax_rates
tables.comment: Tax rates applied to invoices and subscriptions

columns.name: jurisdiction
columns.comment: The jurisdiction for the tax rate. You can use this label field for tax reporting purposes. It also appears on your customer’s invoice.

columns.name: percentage
columns.comment: Tax rate percentage out of 100. For tax calculations with automatic_tax[enabled]=true, this percentage includes the statutory tax rate of non-taxable jurisdictions.

columns.name: state
columns.comment: [ISO 3166-2 subdivision code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2), without country prefix. For example, "NY" for New York, United States.

columns.name: description
columns.comment: An arbitrary string attached to the tax rate for your internal use only. It will not be visible to your customers.

columns.name: inclusive
columns.comment: This specifies if the tax rate is inclusive or exclusive.

columns.name: display_name
columns.comment: The display name of the tax rates as it will appear to your customer on their receipt email, PDF, and the hosted invoice page.

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: country
columns.comment: Two-letter country code ([ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2)).

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: jurisdiction_level
columns.comment: The level of the jurisdiction that imposes this tax rate. Will be `null` for manually defined tax rates.

columns.name: effective_percentage
columns.comment:
Actual/effective tax rate percentage out of 100. For tax calculations with automatic_tax[enabled]=true,
this percentage reflects the rate actually used to calculate tax based on the product's taxability
and whether the user is registered to collect taxes in the corresponding jurisdiction.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: tax_type
columns.comment: The high-level tax type, such as `vat` or `sales_tax`.

columns.name: active
columns.comment: Defaults to `true`. When set to `false`, this tax rate cannot be used with new applications or Checkout Sessions, but will still work for subscriptions and invoices that already have it set.

tables.comment: Additional metadata fields associated with tax rates.

columns.name: key

columns.name: tax_rate_id
columns.comment: The ID of the tax_rate that this metadata entry is associated with.

columns.name: value
columns.comment: Value of the metadata.

tables.comment:
The customer balance transaction object
represents adjustments to the customer balance.

columns.comment: The amount of this transaction in minor units. Negative values are a credit to the customer.

columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: account_id
columns.comment: The id of the corresponding customer balance account

columns.name: source_id
columns.comment: When a receiver source has a mispayment and is swept to the merchant balance, a "credit" is applied to the customer. The sweep may result in either a SourcePayment or MerchantBalanceAdjustment, and is linked to the customer balance transaction.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: type
columns.comment: The type of transaction.

columns.comment: When a receiver source has a mispayment and is swept to the merchant balance, a "credit" is applied to the customer. The sweep may result in either a SourcePayment or MerchantBalanceAdjustment, and is linked to the customer balance transaction.

columns.name: invoice_id
columns.comment: The invoice, if any.

tables.name: discounts
tables.comment:
A discount represents the actual application of a coupon or promotion code.
It contains information about when the discount began, when it will end, and what it is applied to.

columns.name: customer_id
columns.comment: The ID of the customer associated with this discount.

columns.name: promotion_code_id
columns.comment: The promotion code applied to create this discount.

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: invoice_item_id
columns.comment: The invoice item `id` (or invoice line item `id` for invoice line items of type='subscription') that the discount's coupon was applied to, if it was applied directly to a particular invoice item or invoice line item.

columns.name: end
columns.comment: If the coupon has a duration of `repeating`, the date that this discount will end. If the coupon has a duration of `once` or `forever`, this attribute will be null.

columns.name: subscription_id
columns.comment: The subscription that this coupon is applied to, if it is applied to a particular subscription.

columns.name: coupon_id
columns.comment: The ID of the coupon applied to create this discount.

columns.name: subscription_item_id
columns.comment: The subscription item that this coupon is applied to, if it is applied to a particular subscription item.

columns.name: invoice_id
columns.comment: The invoice that the discount's coupon was applied to, if it was applied directly to a particular invoice.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: checkout_session_id
columns.comment: The Checkout session that this coupon is applied to, if it is applied to a particular session in payment mode. Will not be present for subscription mode.

tables.name: payment_intents
tables.comment: History of payment attempts.

columns.name: review_id
columns.comment: ID of the review associated with this PaymentIntent, if any.

columns.name: customer_id
columns.comment:
ID of the Customer this PaymentIntent belongs to, if one exists.

Payment methods attached to other Customers cannot be used with this PaymentIntent.

If [setup_future_usage](#payment_intent_object-setup_future_usage) is set and this PaymentIntent's payment method is not `card_present`, then the payment method attaches to the Customer after the PaymentIntent has been confirmed and any required actions from the user are complete. If the payment method is `card_present` and isn't a digital wallet, then a [generated_card](https://docs.stripe.com/api/charges/object#charge_object-payment_method_details-card_present-generated_card) payment method representing the card is created and attached to the Customer instead.

columns.name: payment_method_types
columns.comment: The list of payment method types (e.g. card) that this PaymentIntent is allowed to use. A comprehensive list of valid payment method types can be found [here](https://docs.stripe.com/api/payment_methods/object#payment_method_object-type).

columns.name: amount_capturable
columns.comment: Amount that can be captured from this PaymentIntent.

columns.name: description
columns.comment: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

columns.name: last_payment_error_charge
columns.comment: For card errors, the ID of the failed charge.

columns.name: amount_details_tip_amount
columns.comment: Portion of the amount that corresponds to a tip.

columns.name: payment_method_id
columns.comment: ID of the payment method used in this PaymentIntent.

columns.name: amount_details_shipping_from_postal_code
columns.comment: If a physical good is being shipped, the postal code of where it is being shipped from. At most 10 alphanumeric characters long, hyphens are allowed.

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: payment_details_order_reference
columns.comment:
A unique value assigned by the business to identify the transaction. Required for L2 and L3 rates.

Required when the Payment Method Types array contains `card`, including when [automatic_payment_methods.enabled](/api/payment_intents/create#create_payment_intent-automatic_payment_methods-enabled) is set to `true`.

For Cards, this field is truncated to 25 alphanumeric characters, excluding spaces, before being sent to card networks. For Klarna, this field is truncated to 255 characters and is visible to customers when they view the order in the Klarna app.

columns.name: card_request_three_d_secure
columns.comment: We strongly recommend that you rely on our SCA Engine to automatically prompt your customers for authentication based on risk level and [other requirements](/docs/strong-customer-authentication). However, if you wish to request 3D Secure based on logic from your own fraud engine, provide this option. If not provided, this value defaults to `automatic`. Read our guide on [manually requesting 3D Secure](/docs/payments/3d-secure/authentication-flow#manual-three-ds) for more information on how this configuration interacts with Radar and our SCA Engine.

columns.name: receipt_email
columns.comment: Email address that the receipt for the resulting payment will be sent to. If `receipt_email` is specified for a payment in live mode, a receipt will be sent regardless of your [email settings](https://dashboard.stripe.com/account/emails).

columns.name: payment_details_customer_reference
columns.comment:
A unique value to identify the customer. This field is available only for card payments.

This field is truncated to 25 alphanumeric characters, excluding spaces, before being sent to card networks.

columns.name: amount
columns.comment: Amount intended to be collected by this PaymentIntent. A positive integer representing how much to charge in the [smallest currency unit](/docs/currencies#zero-decimal) (e.g., 100 cents to charge $1.00 or 100 to charge ¥100, a zero-decimal currency). The minimum amount is $0.50 US or [equivalent in charge currency](/docs/currencies#minimum-and-maximum-charge-amounts). The amount value supports up to eight digits (e.g., a value of 99999999 for a USD charge of $999,999.99).

columns.name: last_payment_error_source
columns.comment: The [source object](/docs/api/sources/object) for errors returned on a request involving a source.

columns.name: capture_method
columns.comment: Controls when the funds will be captured from the customer's account.

columns.name: application_fee_amount
columns.comment: The amount of the application fee (if any) that will be requested to be applied to the payment and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. The amount of the application fee collected will be capped at the total amount captured. For more information, see the PaymentIntents [use case for connected accounts](/docs/payments/connected-accounts).

columns.name: amount_details_shipping_amount
columns.comment: If a physical good is being shipped, the cost of shipping represented in the [smallest currency unit](/docs/currencies#zero-decimal). An integer greater than or equal to 0.

columns.name: amount_details_discount_amount
columns.comment:
The total discount applied on the transaction represented in the [smallest currency unit](/docs/currencies#zero-decimal). An integer greater than 0.

This field is mutually exclusive with the `amount_details[line_items][#][discount_amount]` field.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: cancellation_reason
columns.comment: Reason for cancellation of this PaymentIntent, either user-provided (`duplicate`, `fraudulent`, `requested_by_customer`, or `abandoned`) or generated by Stripe internally (`failed_invoice`, `void_invoice`, `automatic`, or `expired`).

columns.name: statement_descriptor
columns.comment:
Text that appears on the customer's statement as the statement descriptor for a non-card charge. This value overrides the account's default statement descriptor. For information about requirements, including the 22-character limit, see [the Statement Descriptor docs](https://docs.stripe.com/get-started/account/statement-descriptors).

Setting this value for a card charge returns an error. For card charges, set the [statement_descriptor_suffix](https://docs.stripe.com/get-started/account/statement-descriptors#dynamic) instead.

columns.name: confirmation_method
columns.comment: Describes whether we can confirm this PaymentIntent automatically, or if it requires customer action to confirm the payment.

columns.name: status
columns.comment: Status of this PaymentIntent, one of `requires_payment_method`, `requires_confirmation`, `requires_action`, `processing`, `requires_capture`, `canceled`, or `succeeded`. Read more about each PaymentIntent [status](/docs/payments/intents#intent-statuses).

columns.name: on_behalf_of_id
columns.comment: The account (if any) for which the funds of the PaymentIntent are intended. See the PaymentIntents [use case for connected accounts](/docs/payments/connected-accounts) for details.

columns.name: amount_details_surcharge_amount
columns.comment: Portion of the amount that corresponds to a surcharge. Refer to the [amount_surcharge](/docs/api/payment_intents/object#payment_intent_object-amount_surcharge) field for information about how to apply a surcharge.

columns.name: last_payment_error_type
columns.comment: The type of error returned. One of `api_error`, `card_error`, `idempotency_error`, or `invalid_request_error`

columns.name: amount_details_shipping_to_postal_code
columns.comment: If a physical good is being shipped, the postal code of where it is being shipped to. At most 10 alphanumeric characters long, hyphens are allowed.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: canceled_at
columns.comment: Populated when `status` is `canceled`, this is the time at which the PaymentIntent was canceled. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: invoice_id
columns.comment: ID of the invoice that created this PaymentIntent, if it exists.

columns.name: application_id
columns.comment: ID of the Connect application that created the PaymentIntent.

columns.name: statement_descriptor_suffix
columns.comment: Provides information about a card charge. Concatenated to the account's [statement descriptor prefix](https://docs.stripe.com/get-started/account/statement-descriptors#static) to form the complete statement descriptor that appears on the customer's statement.

columns.name: amount_details_tax_total_tax_amount
columns.comment:
The total amount of tax on the transaction represented in the [smallest currency unit](/docs/currencies#zero-decimal). Required for L2 rates. An integer greater than or equal to 0.

This field is mutually exclusive with the `amount_details[line_items][#][tax][total_tax_amount]` field.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: setup_future_usage
columns.comment:
Indicates that you intend to make future payments with this PaymentIntent's payment method.

If you provide a Customer with the PaymentIntent, you can use this parameter to [attach the payment method](/payments/save-during-payment) to the Customer after the PaymentIntent is confirmed and the customer completes any required actions. If you don't provide a Customer, you can still [attach](/api/payment_methods/attach) the payment method to a Customer after the transaction completes.

If the payment method is `card_present` and isn't a digital wallet, Stripe creates and attaches a [generated_card](/api/charges/object#charge_object-payment_method_details-card_present-generated_card) payment method representing the card to the Customer instead.

When processing card payments, Stripe uses `setup_future_usage` to help you comply with regional legislation and network rules, such as [SCA](/strong-customer-authentication).

tables.name: plans
tables.comment:
A subscription plan contains the pricing information for different products and
feature levels on your site.

columns.name: tiers_mode
columns.comment: Defines if the tiering price should be `graduated` or `volume` based. In `volume`-based tiering, the maximum quantity within a period determines the per unit price. In `graduated` tiering, pricing can change as the quantity grows.

columns.name: transform_usage_divide_by
columns.comment: Divide usage by this number.

columns.name: transform_usage_round
columns.comment: After division, either round the result `up` or `down`.

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: trial_period_days
columns.comment: Default number of trial days when subscribing a customer to this price using trial_from_plan=true.

columns.name: amount
columns.comment: The unit amount in cents to be charged, represented as a whole integer if possible. Only set if billing_scheme=per_unit.

columns.name: interval
columns.comment: The frequency at which a subscription is billed. One of day, week, month or year.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: The ID of the price object.

columns.name: unit_amount_decimal
columns.comment: The unit amount in cents to be charged, represented as a decimal string with at most 12 decimal places. Only set if `billing_scheme=per_unit`.

columns.name: usage_type
columns.comment: Configures how the quantity per period should be determined. Can be either `metered` or `licensed`. `licensed` automatically bills the `quantity` set when adding it to a subscription. `metered` aggregates the total usage based on usage records. Defaults to `licensed`.

columns.name: product_id
columns.comment: The ID of the product this plan is associated with.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: billing_scheme
columns.comment: Describes how to compute the price per period. Either `per_unit` or `tiered`. `per_unit` indicates that the fixed amount (specified in `unit_amount` or `unit_amount_decimal`) will be charged per unit in `quantity` (for prices with `usage_type=licensed`), or per unit of total usage (for prices with `usage_type=metered`). `tiered` indicates that the unit pricing will be computed using a tiering strategy as defined using the `tiers` and `tiers_mode` attributes.

columns.name: interval_count
columns.comment: The number of intervals (specified in the interval attribute) between subscription billings. For example, interval=month and interval_count=3 bills every 3 months.

columns.name: aggregate_usage
columns.comment: Specifies a usage aggregation strategy for prices of `usage_type=metered`. Defaults to `sum`.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: nickname
columns.comment: A brief description of the price, hidden from customers.

tables.comment: Additional metadata entries for plans

If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

Each element represents a pricing tier. This parameter requires `billing_scheme` to be set to `tiered`.
"See also the documentation for `billing_scheme`.

columns.name: flat_amount_decimal
columns.comment: Same as flat_amount, but contains a decimal value with at most 12 decimal places

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: amount_decimal
columns.comment: Same as amount, but contains a decimal value with at most 12 decimal places

columns.name: upto

columns.name: flat_amount
columns.comment: Price for the entire tier.

tables.name: prices
tables.comment:
The price object defines the unit cost (or tiered cost) for both recurring and one-time prices.
For example, you might have a $5/month recurring price
for access to your product, and a $10 one-time price
for setup fees when provisioning your product.

columns.name: custom_unit_amount_minimum
columns.comment: The minimum unit amount the customer can specify for this item. Must be at least the minimum charge amount.

columns.name: tiers_mode
columns.comment: Defines if the tiering price should be `graduated` or `volume` based. In `volume`-based tiering, the maximum quantity within a period determines the per unit price. In `graduated` tiering, pricing can change as the quantity grows.

columns.name: recurring_interval_count
columns.comment: The number of intervals (specified in the interval attribute) between subscription billings. For example, interval=month and interval_count=3 bills every 3 months.

columns.name: recurring_interval
columns.comment: The frequency at which a subscription is billed. One of day, week, month or year.

columns.name: lookup_key
columns.comment: A lookup key used to retrieve prices dynamically from a static string. This may be up to 200 characters.

columns.name: recurring_trial_period_days
columns.comment: Default number of trial days when subscribing a customer to this price using trial_from_plan=true.

columns.name: transform_quantity_round
columns.comment: After division, either round the result `up` or `down`.

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: custom_unit_amount_default
columns.comment: The starting unit amount which can be updated by the customer.

columns.name: recurring_usage_type
columns.comment: Configures how the quantity per period should be determined. Can be either `metered` or `licensed`. `licensed` automatically bills the `quantity` set when adding it to a subscription. `metered` aggregates the total usage based on usage records. Defaults to `licensed`.

columns.name: transform_quantity_divide_by
columns.comment: Divide usage by this number.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: The ID of the price object.

columns.name: unit_amount_decimal
columns.comment: The unit amount in cents to be charged, represented as a decimal string with at most 12 decimal places. Only set if `billing_scheme=per_unit`.

columns.name: recurring_meter_id
columns.comment: The meter tracking the usage of a metered price

columns.name: product_id
columns.comment: The ID of the product this price is associated with.

columns.name: tax_behavior
columns.comment: Only required if a [default tax behavior](/docs/tax/products-prices-tax-categories-tax-behavior#setting-a-default-tax-behavior-(recommended)) was not provided in the Stripe Tax settings. Specifies whether the price is considered inclusive of taxes or exclusive of taxes. One of `inclusive`, `exclusive`, or `unspecified`. Once specified as either `inclusive` or `exclusive`, it cannot be changed.

columns.name: custom_unit_amount_maximum
columns.comment: The maximum unit amount the customer can specify for this item.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: billing_scheme
columns.comment: Describes how to compute the price per period. Either `per_unit` or `tiered`. `per_unit` indicates that the fixed amount (specified in `unit_amount` or `unit_amount_decimal`) will be charged per unit in `quantity` (for prices with `usage_type=licensed`), or per unit of total usage (for prices with `usage_type=metered`). `tiered` indicates that the unit pricing will be computed using a tiering strategy as defined using the `tiers` and `tiers_mode` attributes.

columns.name: type
columns.comment: One of `one_time` or `recurring` depending on whether the price is for a one-time purchase or a recurring (subscription) purchase.

columns.name: recurring_aggregate_usage
columns.comment: Specifies a usage aggregation strategy for prices of `usage_type=metered`. Defaults to `sum`.

columns.name: unit_amount
columns.comment: The unit amount in cents to be charged, represented as a whole integer if possible. Only set if billing_scheme=per_unit.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: active
columns.comment: Whether the price can be used for new purchases.

columns.name: nickname
columns.comment: A brief description of the price, hidden from customers.

tables.name: promotion_codes
tables.comment: A Promotion Code represents a customer-redeemable code for a coupon. It can be used to create multiple codes for a single coupon.

columns.name: restrictions_minium_amount_currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO code](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies) for minimum_amount

columns.name: customer_id
columns.comment: The customer that this promotion code can be used by.

columns.name: restrictions_first_time_transaction
columns.comment: A Boolean indicating if the Promotion Code should only be redeemed for Customers without any successful payments or invoices

columns.name: times_redeemed
columns.comment: Number of times this promotion code has been used.

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: coupon_id
columns.comment: The coupon for this promotion code.

columns.name: code
columns.comment: The customer-facing code. Regardless of case, this code must be unique across all active promotion codes for each customer.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: expires_at
columns.comment: Date at which the promotion code can no longer be redeemed.

columns.name: restrictions_minium_amount
columns.comment: Minimum amount required to redeem this Promotion Code into a Coupon (e.g., a purchase must be $100 or more to work).

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: max_redemptions
columns.comment: Maximum number of times this promotion code can be redeemed.

columns.name: active
columns.comment: Whether the promotion code is currently active. A promotion code is only active if the coupon is also valid.

tables.name: quotes
tables.comment: A Quote is a way to model prices that you’d like to provide to a customer. Once accepted, it will automatically create an invoice, subscription or subscription schedule..

columns.name: recurring_line_item_group
columns.comment: The ID of the recurring line items associated with this quote

columns.name: number
columns.comment: A unique number that identifies this particular quote. This number is assigned once the quote is finalized.

columns.name: transfer_data_amount
columns.comment: The amount in cents that will be transferred to the destination account when the invoice is paid. By default, the entire amount is transferred to the destination.

columns.name: application_fee_percent
columns.comment: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice total that will be transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. Only applicable if there are line items with recurring prices on the quote.

columns.name: collection_method
columns.comment: Either charge_automatically, or send_invoice. When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay invoices at the end of the subscription cycle or on finalization using the default payment method attached to the subscription or customer. When sending an invoice, Stripe will email your customer an invoice with payment instructions and mark the subscription as active. Defaults to charge_automatically.

columns.name: customer_id
columns.comment: The customer which this quote belongs to. A customer is required before finalizing the quote. Once specified, it cannot be changed.

columns.name: subscription_data_billing_mode_type
columns.comment: Controls how prorations and invoices for subscriptions are calculated and orchestrated.

columns.name: description
columns.comment: A description that will be displayed on the quote PDF.

columns.name: cloned_from
columns.comment: The quote that was cloned.

columns.name: finalized_at
columns.comment: The time that the quote was finalized

columns.name: automatic_tax_enabled
columns.comment: Automatically calculate taxes

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: transfer_data_destination_id

columns.name: subscription_data_effective_date
columns.comment: When creating a new subscription, the date of which the subscription schedule will start after the quote is accepted. This date is ignored if it is in the past when the quote is accepted.

columns.name: subscription_data_proration_discounts
columns.comment: Controls how invoices and invoice items display proration amounts and discount amounts. `itemized` means that amounts are gross and discount amounts are accurate; `included` means that amounts are net and discount amounts are zero. This field is only populated for `billing_mode=flexible` quotes.

columns.name: is_revision

columns.name: application_fee_amount

columns.name: line_item_group

columns.comment: The status of the quote.

columns.comment: The account on behalf of which to charge. See the Connect documentation for details.

columns.name: amount_total

columns.name: default_tax_rates
columns.comment: The tax rates applied to this quote.

columns.name: upcoming_line_item_group
columns.comment: The ID of the upcoming line items

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

columns.name: header
columns.comment: A header that will be displayed on the quote PDF.

columns.name: invoice_settings_days_until_due
columns.comment: Number of days within which a customer must pay invoices generated by this quote.

columns.name: transfer_data_destination_amount_percent
columns.comment: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice total that will be transferred to the destination account. By default, the entire amount will be transferred to the destination.

columns.name: subscription_id
columns.comment: The subscription that was created or updated from this quote.

columns.name: automatic_tax_status
columns.comment: The status of the most recent automated tax calculation for this quote.

columns.name: canceled_at

columns.name: footer

columns.name: subscription_data_trial_period_days

columns.name: invoice_id
columns.comment: The invoice that was created from this quote.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: amount_subtotal
columns.comment: Total before any discounts or taxes are applied.

Indicates the directions of money movement for which this payment method is intended to be used.

Include `inbound` if you intend to use the payment method as the origin to pull funds from. Include `outbound` if you intend to use the payment method as the destination to send funds to. You can include both if you intend to use the payment method for both purposes.

It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: card_request_three_d_secure
columns.comment: We strongly recommend that you rely on our SCA Engine to automatically prompt your customers for authentication based on risk level and [other requirements](/docs/strong-customer-authentication). However, if you wish to request 3D Secure based on logic from your own fraud engine, provide this option. If not provided, this value defaults to `automatic`. Read our guide on [manually requesting 3D Secure](/docs/payments/3d-secure/authentication-flow#manual-three-ds) for more information on how this configuration interacts with Radar and our SCA Engine.

columns.comment: The start of this phase of the subscription schedule.

columns.name: collection_method
columns.comment: Either `charge_automatically`, or `send_invoice`. When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay the underlying subscription at the end of each billing cycle using the default source attached to the customer. When sending an invoice, Stripe will email your customer an invoice with payment instructions and mark the subscription as `active`.

columns.name: billing_thresholds_amount_gte
columns.comment: Monetary threshold that triggers the subscription to create an invoice.

columns.comment: Subscription description, meant to be displayable to the customer. Use this field to optionally store an explanation of the subscription for rendering in Stripe surfaces and certain local payment methods UIs.

columns.comment: Default settings for automatic tax computation.

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.comment: The account (if any) the charge was made on behalf of for charges associated with the schedule's subscription. See the Connect documentation for details.

columns.name: end_date
columns.comment: The end of this phase of the subscription schedule.

columns.name: trial_end
columns.comment: When the trial ends within the phase.

columns.name: transfer_data_amount_percent
columns.comment: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice total that will be transferred to the destination account. By default, the entire amount is transferred to the destination.

columns.name: transfer_data_destination
columns.comment: The account where funds from the payment will be transferred to upon payment success.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: invoice_settings_days_until_due
columns.comment: The number of days from when the invoice is created until it is due.

columns.name: coupon_id
columns.comment: ID of the coupon to use during this phase of the subscription schedule.

columns.name: default_payment_method
columns.comment: ID of the default payment method for the subscription schedule. It must belong to the customer associated with the subscription schedule. If not set, invoices will use the default payment method in the customer's invoice settings.

columns.name: billing_thresholds_reset_billing_cycle_anchor
columns.comment: Indicates if the `billing_cycle_anchor` should be reset when a threshold is reached. If true, `billing_cycle_anchor` will be updated to the date/time the threshold was last reached; otherwise, the value will remain unchanged. This value may not be `true` if the subscription contains items with plans that have `aggregate_usage=last_ever`.

columns.name: proration_behavior
columns.comment: If the subscription schedule will prorate when transitioning to this phase. Possible values are `create_prorations` and `none`.

columns.name: billing_cycle_anchor
columns.comment: Possible values are `phase_start` or `automatic`. If `phase_start` then billing cycle anchor of the subscription is set to the start of the phase when entering the phase. If `automatic` then the billing cycle anchor is automatically modified as needed when entering the phase. For more information, see the billing cycle [documentation](/docs/billing/subscriptions/billing-cycle).

columns.comment: The balance_transaction_id of the capture.

columns.name: amount
columns.comment: Amount intended to be transferred by this Capture. A positive integer representing how much to charge in the [smallest currency unit](/docs/currencies#zero-decimal) (e.g., 100 cents to charge $1.00 or 100 to charge ¥100, a zero-decimal currency). The minimum amount is $0.50 US or [equivalent in charge currency](/docs/currencies#minimum-and-maximum-charge-amounts). The amount value supports up to eight digits (e.g., a value of 99999999 for a USD charge of $999,999.99).

columns.name: id

columns.name: charge_id

tables.comment: An Issuing FundingObligation represents how much money a merchant owes to either Stripe or their controlling platform as well as the status of repayment.

columns.name: amount_outstanding
columns.comment: The amount still unpaid of the amount_total for this obligation, in smallest denomination units for the given currency.

columns.name: paid_at
columns.comment: When this obligation was fully paid off.

columns.name: finalized_at
columns.comment: When the amount_total on this FundingObligation was finalized.

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: due_at
columns.comment: When payment is due. Once this time passes, the FundingObligation status becomes past_due.

columns.name: transaction_period_starts_at
columns.comment: (Only relevant for Direct and Platform users) When the window of cleared transactions contributing to this obligation starts. This field is not visible for reserve FundingObligations.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: credit_period_ends_at
columns.comment: For Connected Accounts, when the window of cleared transactions contributing to this obligation ends. This field is not meaningful for FundingObligations belonging to platforms, and is not visible for reserve FundingObligations.

columns.name: transaction_period_ends_at
columns.comment: (Only relevant for Direct and Platform users) When the window of cleared transactions contributing to this obligation ends. This field is not visible for reserve FundingObligations.

columns.name: status
columns.comment: The current status of this obligation. One of charged_off, needs_refund, paid, past_due, pending, unpaid.

columns.name: owed_to
columns.comment: The party to whom the merchant is responsible for paying the owed amount_total. For platforms, this would be stripe.

columns.name: amount_paid_from_reserve
columns.comment: The amount that has been paid towards this obligation from the platform’s issuing_credit_reserved balance.

columns.name: amount_total
columns.comment: The total owed amount, in smallest denomination units for the given currency.

columns.name: amount_paid
columns.comment: The amount that has been paid towards this obligation, in smallest denomination units for the given currency.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: grace_period_ends_at
columns.comment: When the grace period for fulfilling this obligation ends. Once this time passes and this obligation isn’t paid, authorizations will start to decline.

columns.name: merchant
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the user.

columns.name: livemode
columns.comment: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

columns.name: credit_period_starts_at
columns.comment: For Connected Accounts, when the window of cleared transactions contributing to this obligation starts. This field is not meaningful for FundingObligations belonging to platforms, and is not visible for reserve FundingObligations.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch

columns.name: balance_type
columns.comment: The balance_type that is owed by this obligation. One of issuing or issuing_credit_reserved.

tables.name: issuing_authorizations_request_history
tables.comment: History of every time a pending_request authorization was approved/declined, either by you directly or by Stripe (e.g. based on your spending_controls). If the merchant changes the authorization by performing an incremental authorization, you can look at this field to see the previous requests for the authorization. This field can be helpful in determining why a given authorization was approved/declined.

columns.name: merchant_currency
columns.comment: The currency that was collected by the merchant and presented to the cardholder for the authorization. Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: network_risk_score
columns.comment: The card network's estimate of the likelihood that an authorization is fraudulent. Takes on values between 1 and 99.

columns.name: batch_timestamp
columns.comment: The time in epoch format at which updates to the object were processed through the [Stripe Data Pipeline](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe-data/access-data-in-warehouse). If the object hasn't changed, the time remains unchanged. This field isn't available in Sigma. It's only available for core API tables, including Connect versions, exported through the Stripe Data Pipeline.

columns.name: amount_details_cashback_amount
columns.comment: The amount of cash requested by the cardholder.

columns.name: reason
columns.comment: When an authorization is approved or declined by you or by Stripe, this field provides additional detail on the reason for the outcome.

columns.name: amount
columns.comment: The `pending_request.amount` at the time of the request, presented in your card's currency and in the [smallest currency unit](/docs/currencies#zero-decimal). Stripe held this amount from your account to fund the authorization if the request was approved.

columns.name: amount_details_atm_fee
columns.comment: The fee charged by the ATM for the cash withdrawal.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: reason_message
columns.comment: If the `request_history.reason` is `webhook_error` because the direct webhook response is invalid (for example, parsing errors or missing parameters), we surface a more detailed error message via this field.

columns.name: approved
columns.comment: Whether this request was approved.

columns.name: requested_at
columns.comment: Time when the card network received an authorization request from the acquirer in UTC. Referred to by networks as transmission time.

columns.name: authorization_code
columns.comment: A code created by Stripe which is shared with the merchant to validate the authorization. This field will be populated if the authorization message was approved. The code typically starts with the letter "S", followed by a six-digit number. For example, "S498162". Please note that the code is not guaranteed to be unique across authorizations.

columns.name: merchant_amount
columns.comment: The `pending_request.merchant_amount` at the time of the request, presented in the `merchant_currency` and in the [smallest currency unit](/docs/currencies#zero-decimal).

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

tables.name: recoveries
tables.comment: This table tracks the effectiveness of Stripe's revenue recovery tools for subscriptions and invoices.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: source_id
columns.comment: The Stripe object that this recovery applies to, e.g. an invoice id.

columns.name: source_type
columns.comment: The type of Stripe object that the recovery applies to, currently only `invoice`.

columns.name: on_behalf_of_id
columns.comment: The account (if any) the charge was made on behalf of without triggering an automatic transfer. See the [Connect documentation](/docs/payments/connected-accounts) for details.

columns.name: reporting_currency
columns.comment: The currency in which the recovery is being reported. Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase.

columns.name: amount_due
columns.comment: Final amount due at this time for this invoice. If the invoice's total is smaller than the minimum charge amount, for example, or if there is account credit that can be applied to the invoice, the amount_due may be 0. If there is a positive starting_balance for the invoice (the customer owes money), the amount_due will also take that into account. The charge that gets generated for the invoice will be for the amount specified in amount_due.

columns.name: amount_paid
columns.comment: The amount, in cents, that was paid.

columns.name: paid_at
columns.comment: The time that the invoice was paid.

columns.name: initial_payment_failed_at
columns.comment: The time that this invoice failed a payment for the first time.

columns.name: initial_failed_amount
columns.comment: The amount of the first failed payment attempt for this invoice, if any.

columns.name: initial_payment_decline_reason
columns.comment: An enumerated value providing a more detailed explanation of the outcome's type. Charges blocked by Radar's default block rule have the value highest_risk_level. Charges placed in review by Radar's default review rule have the value elevated_risk_level. Charges authorized, blocked, or placed in review by custom rules have the value rule. See understanding declines for more details.

columns.name: recovered_at
columns.comment: The time that this invoice was recovered.

columns.name: recovered_amount
columns.comment: The amount that was recovered.

columns.name: recovery_method
columns.comment: The mechanism that led to the recovery of the payment.

columns.name: retries_exhausted
columns.comment: Whether Stripe is still retrying payments for this invoice.

columns.name: next_payment_attempt
columns.comment: The time that the next retry is scheduled.

columns.name: attempt_count
columns.comment: The number of payment attempts for this invoice. This includes all payment attempts via the API, dashboard, and Stripe-initiated retries.

columns.name: retry_attempt_count
columns.comment: The number of times that this invoice has been retried by Stripe, including the initial failure.

tables.name: revenue_recognition_debits_and_credits
tables.comment: Contains accounting entries showing debit and credit pairs for revenue recognition transactions. Each row represents a single journal entry with the debited and credited accounts, amounts, and related Stripe objects like invoices, charges, and subscriptions. This data is used for financial reporting and ensuring proper revenue recognition according to accounting standards.

columns.name: event_type

tables.name: tax_transactions
tables.comment: A tax transaction is a record of tax collected from or refunded to your customer.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the tax transaction.

columns.name: type
columns.comment: The type of tax transaction. The transaction reverses an earlier transaction when `type` is `reversal`. Possible values are `transaction` and `reversal`.

columns.name: provider
columns.comment: The origin of the tax transaction. This will be `stripe` for Stripe transactions or the platform specified in an [import](https://docs.stripe.com/tax/reports#tax-data-imports) for third-party transactions.

columns.name: reference
columns.comment: A custom identifier for the tax transaction. This will only be set when `source_type` is `external`.

columns.name: source_id
columns.comment: The ID of the object that triggered the creation of the tax transaction. This will be equal to `reference` when `source_type` is `external`.

columns.name: source_type
columns.comment: The type of object that triggered the creation of the tax transaction. Possible values are `checkout`, `credit_note`, `external`, `invoice`, `payment_intent` and `refund`.

columns.name: tax_date
columns.comment: The time at which effective tax rules and rates were applied to the tax transaction. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: The time at which the tax transaction was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: posted_at
columns.comment: The time at which the tax liability is assumed or reduced. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: customer_id
columns.comment: The ID of the customer associated with the tax transaction.

columns.name: customer_details_address_source
columns.comment: The type of customer address applicable to the tax transaction. Possible values are `billing` and `shipping`.

columns.name: customer_details_address_city
columns.comment: The city, district, suburb, town, or village of the customer's address at the time the tax transaction was recorded.

columns.name: customer_details_address_country
columns.comment: The country of the customer's address at the time the tax transaction was recorded. This is a two-letter [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) code when `source_type` is `external`, otherwise it's freeform.

columns.name: customer_details_address_line1
columns.comment: The line 1 of the customer's address at the time the tax transaction was recorded (for example, street, PO Box, or company name).

columns.name: customer_details_address_line2
columns.comment: The line 2 of the customer's address at the time the tax transaction was recorded (for example, apartment, suite, unit, or building).

columns.name: customer_details_address_postal_code
columns.comment: The ZIP or postal code of the customer's address at the time the tax transaction was recorded.

columns.name: customer_details_address_state
columns.comment: The state, county, province, or region of the customer's address at the time the tax transaction was recorded. This value is freeform.

columns.name: customer_details_ip_address
columns.comment: The customer's IP address. This will be either an IPv4 or IPv6 address.

columns.name: customer_details_taxability_override
columns.comment: The taxability override used for taxation. Possible values are `customer_exempt`, `reverse_charge` and `none`.

columns.name: reversal_original_tax_transaction_id
columns.comment: The ID of original tax transaction that was reversed when `type` is `reversal`.

tables.name: tax_transaction_line_items
tables.comment: The tax collected or refunded, by line item.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the tax transaction line item.

columns.name: tax_transaction_id
columns.comment: The ID of the tax transaction associated with the tax transaction line item.

columns.name: reference
columns.comment: A custom identifier for the tax transaction line item. This will only be set when the tax transaction `source_type` is `external`.

columns.name: source_line_item_id
columns.comment: The ID of the line item associated with the tax transaction line item (for example, an invoice line item ID when the tax transaction `source_type` is `invoice`). This will be equal to `reference` when `tax_transactions` `source_type` is `external`.

columns.name: tax_behavior
columns.comment: Indicates whether `amount` includes taxes. Taxes are included in `amount` when `tax_behavior` is `inclusive` and excluded from `amount` when `tax_behavior` is `exclusive`. Possible values are `inclusive` and `exclusive`.

columns.name: tax_code
columns.comment: The [product tax code](https://docs.stripe.com/tax/tax-codes) associated with the tax transaction line item.

columns.name: quantity_decimal
columns.comment: The number of units being purchased or reversed when the tax transaction `type` is `reversal`. This value is represented as a decimal string.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: The three-letter [ISO code for the currency](https://docs.stripe.com/currencies) in which `amount` is defined. This is the [presentment currency](https://docs.stripe.com/currencies#presentment-currencies), which can differ from both the settlement currency and the tax authority's local filing currency.

columns.name: amount
columns.comment: The amount in the [smallest currency unit](https://docs.corp.stripe.com/currencies#zero-decimal). This includes taxes when `tax_behavior` is `inclusive`.

columns.name: amount_tax
columns.comment: The amount of tax calculated for the tax transaction line item, in the [smallest currency unit](https://docs.corp.stripe.com/currencies#zero-decimal).

columns.name: determined_origin_address_city
columns.comment: The city, district, suburb, town, or village of the tax transaction's origin address [as determined by](https://docs.stripe.com/tax/calculating#how-stripe-uses-addresses) Stripe Tax.

columns.name: determined_origin_address_country
columns.comment: The country of the tax transaction's origin address [as determined by](https://docs.stripe.com/tax/calculating#how-stripe-uses-addresses) Stripe Tax. This is a two-letter [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) code.

columns.name: determined_origin_address_line1
columns.comment: The line 1 of the tax transaction's origin address [as determined by](https://docs.stripe.com/tax/calculating#how-stripe-uses-addresses) Stripe Tax.

columns.name: determined_origin_address_line2
columns.comment: The line 2 of the tax transaction's origin address [as determined by](https://docs.stripe.com/tax/calculating#how-stripe-uses-addresses) Stripe Tax.

columns.name: determined_origin_address_postal_code
columns.comment: The ZIP or postal code of the tax transaction's origin address [as determined by](https://docs.stripe.com/tax/calculating#how-stripe-uses-addresses) Stripe Tax.

columns.name: determined_origin_address_state
columns.comment: The state, county, province, or region of the tax transaction's origin address [as determined by](https://docs.stripe.com/tax/calculating#how-stripe-uses-addresses) Stripe Tax. This is a [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2) code without the country prefix.

columns.name: determined_destination_address_city
columns.comment: The city, district, suburb, town, or village of the customer's address [as determined by](https://docs.stripe.com/tax/customer-locations#address-hierarchy) Stripe Tax using available customer details.

columns.name: determined_destination_address_country
columns.comment: The country of the customer's address [as determined by](https://docs.stripe.com/tax/customer-locations#address-hierarchy) Stripe Tax using available customer details. This is a two-letter [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) code.

columns.name: determined_destination_address_line1
columns.comment: The line 1 of the customer's address [as determined by](https://docs.stripe.com/tax/customer-locations#address-hierarchy) Stripe Tax using available customer details.

columns.name: determined_destination_address_line2
columns.comment: The line 2 of the customer's address [as determined by](https://docs.stripe.com/tax/customer-locations#address-hierarchy) Stripe Tax using available customer details.

columns.name: determined_destination_address_postal_code
columns.comment: The ZIP or postal code of the customer's address [as determined by](https://docs.stripe.com/tax/customer-locations#address-hierarchy) Stripe Tax using available customer details.

columns.name: determined_destination_address_state
columns.comment: The state, county, province, or region of the customer's address [as determined by](https://docs.stripe.com/tax/customer-locations#address-hierarchy) Stripe Tax using available customer details. This is a [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2) code without the country prefix.

columns.name: product_id
columns.comment: The ID of the [product](https://docs.stripe.com/invoicing/products-prices) associated with the tax transaction line item. This will only be set when the tax transaction `source_type` is `external`.

columns.name: reversal_original_tax_transaction_line_item_id
columns.comment: The ID of the original tax transaction line item that was reversed when the tax transaction `type` is `reversal`.

tables.name: tax_transactions_metadata
tables.comment: Additional metadata fields associated with tax transactions.

columns.name: tax_transaction_id
columns.comment: The ID of the tax transaction that this metadata entry is associated with.

columns.name: key
columns.comment: Name of the metadata key.

columns.name: value
columns.comment: Value of the metadata.

tables.name: tax_transaction_line_items_metadata
tables.comment: Additional metadata fields associated with tax transaction line items.

columns.name: tax_transaction_line_item_id
columns.comment: The ID of the tax transaction line item that this metadata entry is associated with.

columns.name: key
columns.comment: Name of the metadata key.

columns.name: value
