tables.name: tax_transaction_jurisdiction_details
tables.comment: A comprehensive breakdown displaying the most granular elements of a specific tax transaction item, along with information on the relevant jurisdictions contributing to the overall tax applied to that transaction.

columns.name: tax_transaction_id
columns.comment: The ID of the tax transaction associated with jurisdiction detail.

columns.name: tax_transaction_item_id
columns.comment: The ID of the tax transaction item associated with the jurisdiction detail. This will be the tax transaction line item ID when `tax_transaction_item_type` is `tax_transaction_line_item` and the tax transaction shipping cost ID when `tax_transaction_item_type` is `tax_transaction_shipping_cost`.

columns.name: tax_transaction_item_type
columns.comment: The type of the tax transaction item associated with the jurisdiction detail. Possible values are `tax_transaction_line_item` and `tax_transaction_shipping_cost`.

columns.name: taxability_reason
columns.comment: The reason for the taxability of the jurisdiction detail. Possible values are `customer_exempt`, `not_collecting`, `not_subject_to_tax`, `jurisdiction_unsupported`, `not_supported`, `product_exempt`, `product_exempt_holiday`, `reduced_rated`, `standard_rated`, `reverse_charge`, `zero_rated`, `taxable_basis_reduced`, `portion_standard_rated`, `portion_reduced_rated`, `portion_product_exempt` or `proportionally_rated`.

columns.name: tax_rate_percentage
columns.comment: The tax rate percentage out of 100 for the jurisdiction, used for calculating tax on the taxable amount. Rounded to 6 decimal places.

columns.name: taxability
columns.comment: Indicates whether the tax transaction item is taxable in the applicable jurisdiction. Possible values are `taxable` and `nontaxable`.

columns.name: jurisdiction_name
columns.comment: The name of the jurisdiction that imposed the tax.

columns.name: jurisdiction_level
columns.comment: The level of the jurisdiction that imposed the tax. Possible values are `country`, `state`, `county`, `city` and `district`.

columns.name: jurisdiction_country
columns.comment: The country of the jurisdiction where tax was imposed. This is a two-letter [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) code that represents the tax transaction item's origin country for origin-based tax collection or the item's destination country for destination-based tax collection.

columns.name: jurisdiction_state
columns.comment: The state, county, province, or region of the jurisdiction where tax was imposed. This is an [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2) code without the country prefix that represents the tax transaction item's origin state for origin-based tax collection or destination state for destination-based tax collection. This may be `null` when `jurisdiction_level` is `country`.

columns.name: tax_type
columns.comment: The type of imposed tax. Possible values are `sales_tax`, `use_tax`, `vat`, `gst`, `pst`, `hst`, `qst`, `ct`, `sst`, `rst`, `jct`, `igst`, `lease_tax`, `communications_tax`, `amusement_tax`, `service_tax`, `gross_receipts_communications_tax` and `service_communications_tax`. This value may be `null` when `taxability_reason` is `not_collecting`, `jurisdiction_unsupported`, `not_subject_to_tax`, `reverse_charge` or `not_supported`.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: The three-letter [ISO code for the currency](https://docs.stripe.com/currencies) in which `amount_taxable`, `amount_non_taxable` and `amount_tax` are defined. This is the [presentment currency](https://docs.stripe.com/currencies#presentment-currencies), which can differ from both the settlement currency and the tax authority's local filing currency.

columns.name: amount_taxable
columns.comment: The amount of the tax transaction item that is considered taxable, in the [smallest currency unit](https://docs.corp.stripe.com/currencies).

columns.name: amount_non_taxable
columns.comment: The amount of the tax transaction item that is considered non-taxable, in the [smallest currency unit](https://docs.corp.stripe.com/currencies).

columns.name: amount_tax
columns.comment: The amount of tax calculated for the applicable jurisdiction that makes up the tax transaction item amount tax, in the [smallest currency unit](https://docs.corp.stripe.com/currencies).

columns.name: filing_currency
columns.comment: The three-letter [ISO code for the local currency](https://docs.corp.stripe.com/currencies) used by the applicable tax authority. The values for `filing_amount_taxable`, `filing_amount_non_taxable` and `filing_amount_tax` are expressed in this currency. This value may be `null` for `taxability_reason` values of `not_supported`, `not_subject_to_tax` and `not_collecting`.

columns.name: filing_amount_taxable
columns.comment: The amount in the [smallest currency unit](https://docs.corp.stripe.com/currencies) of the tax transaction item that is taxable, expressed in the tax authority's local filing currency. This will be `null` when `filing_currency` is `null`.

columns.name: filing_amount_non_taxable
columns.comment: The amount in the [smallest currency unit](https://docs.corp.stripe.com/currencies) of the tax transaction item that is non-taxable, expressed in the tax authority's local filing currency. This will be `null` when `filing_currency` is `null`.

columns.name: filing_amount_tax
columns.comment: The amount of tax calculated in the [smallest currency unit](https://docs.corp.stripe.com/currencies) of the tax transaction item, expressed in the tax authority's local filing currency. This will be `null` when `filing_currency` is `null`.

tables.name: tax_transaction_customer_tax_ids
tables.comment: The customer tax IDs for the associated tax transaction.

columns.name: tax_transaction_id
columns.comment: The ID of the tax transaction associated with the customer's tax ID.

columns.name: type
columns.comment: The type of the customer's tax ID. This will be a [supported](https://docs.corp.stripe.com/billing/customer/tax-ids#supported-tax-id) tax ID type or `unknown` for some legacy tax IDs.

columns.name: country
columns.comment: The country of the customer's tax ID. This will a two-letter [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) code or `EU` when `type` is `eu_oss_vat`.

columns.name: value
columns.comment: The value of the customer's tax ID.

tables.name: summarized_balance_transactions
tables.comment: Balance Transaction Summary by 15 minute interval.

columns.name: auto_payout_id
columns.comment: The ID of the auto payout this balance transaction is included in.

columns.name: reporting_category
columns.comment: (Beta) [Reporting category](https://stripe.com/docs/reporting/reporting-categories) is a top-level categorization of balance transactions for financial accounting purposes.

columns.name: bt_effective_at_interval_start
columns.comment: The start of the time interval (UTC) to which we attribute the balance transactions summarized in this row. BTs are attributed by their available_on date if an auto payout or by their created date otherwise. This time interval is a slice of (currently) 15 minutes used to group these timestamps.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO code for the currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies) in which the amount is defined.

columns.name: auto_payout_effective_at_interval_start
columns.comment: The start of the time interval (UTC) to which we attribute the automatic payout's balance transaction in which these summarized balance transactions were paid out. This time interval is a slice of (currently) 15 minutes used to group these timestamps.

columns.name: gross
columns.comment: Gross amount of this activity, expressed in minor units of the currency (e.g., cents for USD, or yen for JPY).

columns.name: fee
columns.comment: Fees incurred on this activity, expressed in minor units of the currency (e.g., cents for USD, or yen for JPY).

columns.name: net
columns.comment: Net amount of this activity, expressed in minor units of the currency (e.g., cents for USD, or yen for JPY).

columns.name: bt_count
columns.comment: Number of balance transactions summarized in this row.

columns.name: activity_at_time_bucket
columns.comment: The beginning of the time bucket (UTC) to which we attribute the activity summarized in this row. Time buckets are (currently) 15 minutes slices [inclusive start, exclusive end) used to group these timestamps. Charges are attributed to the time of charge. Post-billed fees are attributed to near the end of the day or end of the month.

columns.name: payout_is_auto
columns.comment: When the reporting_category = 'payout', indicates whether the associated payout is an auto payout.

columns.name: bt_effective_at_interval_start

BTs are attributed by their available_on date if an auto payout or by their created date otherwise. This time interval is a slice of (currently) 15 minutes used to group these timestamps.

columns.name: auto_payout_effective_at_interval_start
columns.comment: The start of the time interval (UTC) to which we attribute the automatic payout's balance transaction in which these summarized balance transactions were paid out. This time interval is a slice of (currently) 15 minutes used to group these timestamps.

columns.name: gross

columns.name: fee

columns.name: net

columns.name: activity_at_time_bucket
columns.comment: The beginning of the time bucket (UTC) to which we attribute the activity summarized in this row. Time buckets are (currently) 15 minutes slices [inclusive start, exclusive end) used to group these timestamps. Charges are attributed to the time of charge. Post-billed fees are attributed to near the end of the day or end of the month.

tables.name: billing_meters
tables.comment: Meters specify how to aggregate meter events over a billing period. Meter events represent the actions that customers take in your system. Meters attach to prices and form the basis of the bill.

columns.name: livemode
columns.comment: Has the value `true` if the object exists in live mode or the value `false` if the object exists in test mode.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier of the `billing_meters` object.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the meter was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch

columns.name: updated
columns.comment: Time at which the meter was updated. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch

columns.name: deactivated
columns.comment: Time at which the meter was deactivated. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch

columns.name: status
columns.comment: The meter’s status.

columns.name: event_name
columns.comment: The name of the meter event to record usage for. Corresponds with the `event_name` field on meter events.

columns.name: display_name
columns.comment: The meter’s name.

columns.name: event_time_window
columns.comment: The time window to pre-aggregate meter events for, if any.

columns.name: default_aggregation_formula
columns.comment: Specifies how events are aggregated.

columns.name: customer_mapping_event_payload_key
columns.comment: The key in the meter event payload to use for mapping the event to a customer. E.g., `stripe_customer_id`

columns.name: customer_mapping_type
columns.comment: The method for mapping a meter event to a customer. Must be `by_id` (map a meter event to a customer by passing a customer ID in the event’s payload).

columns.name: value_settings_event_payload_key
columns.comment: The key in the usage event payload to use as the value for this meter. E.g., `value` or `bytes_used`.

tables.name: billing_meter_dimensions
tables.comment: Meters specify how to aggregate meter events over a billing period. Dimensions are a list of keys that are specified when a billing meter is created. These keys are used to group usage events sent to that billing meter.

columns.name: meter_id
columns.comment: The identifier of the `billing_meters` object that this dimension payload key is associated with.

columns.name: dimension_payload_key
columns.comment: Name of the dimension payload key that will be used to group meter events by.

tables.name: billing_meter_event_summaries
tables.comment: A billing meter event summary represents an aggregated view of a customer’s billing meter events within a per-minute or hourly timeframe. It indicates how much usage was accrued by a customer for that period.

columns.name: livemode
columns.comment: Has the value `true` if the object exists in live mode or the value `false` if the object exists in test mode.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier of the `billing_meter_event_summaries` object.

columns.name: meter_id
columns.comment: Unique identifier of the `billing_meters` object associated with this usage.

columns.name: customer_id
columns.comment: Unique identifier of the `customer` object that created this usage.

columns.name: segment_hash
columns.comment: The deterministic hash of the `segment` map for this usage event.

columns.name: value_grouping_window
columns.comment: Specifies what granularity this usage object represents. E.g., 'HOUR' or 'MINUTE'.

columns.name: start_time
columns.comment: Start timestamp for this event summary (inclusive). Aligned with minute boundaries. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: end_time
columns.comment: End timestamp for this event summary (exclusive). Aligned with minute boundaries. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: aggregated_value
columns.comment: Aggregated value of all the events within `start_time` (inclusive) and `end_time` (inclusive). The aggregation strategy is defined on the billing meter via `default_aggregation_formula`.

tables.name: billing_meter_event_summary_segments
tables.comment: When creating a billing meter, dimensions, which are a list of keys, are specified. These keys are used to group usage events that are sent to the billing meter. A segment is used to define the group of key-value pairs that are associated with a usage event.

columns.name: event_summary_id
columns.comment: The identifier of the billing_meter_event_summaries object that this segment is associated with.

columns.name: dimension_key
columns.comment: Name of the dimension key.

columns.name: dimension_value
columns.comment: Value of the dimension.

tables.name: billing_meter_invalid_events
tables.comment: An invalid billing meter event represents a billing meter event that does not pass validation. For example, this includes events that specify an invalid meter ID or specify a value that is a non-positive integer.

columns.name: livemode
columns.comment: Has the value `true` if the object exists in live mode or the value `false` if the object exists in test mode.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier of the `billing_meter_invalid_events` object (UUID4). This is also the `event_id` of the raw billing meter event object.

columns.name: meter_id
columns.comment: Unique identifier of the `billing_meters` object associated with this event.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: The time of the event. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: received
columns.comment: The time the event was received by the billing meter. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: error_code
columns.comment: A short summary of why this event was invalid.

columns.name: error_message
columns.comment: An explanation of why the event did not pass validation.

columns.name: event_name
columns.comment: The name of the meter event that was specified for this event. Corresponds with the `event_name` field on a meter.

tables.name: billing_meter_invalid_events_payload
tables.comment: The payload sent with an associated invalid billing meter event.

columns.name: event_id
columns.comment: The unique identifier of the `billing_meter_invalid_events` object that this metadata entry is associated with.

columns.name: key
columns.comment: Name of the metadata key.

columns.name: value
columns.comment: Value of the metadata.
